Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: judymster
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the heart of the city...convenient to great shopping! Staff was very friendly, rooms and amenities top notch. The most comfortable bed in the whole wide world!! Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: YYZ17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel over the long weekend and could not have been happier with our stay. Excellent hospitality, great location and a wonderful restaurant for brunch :) I give 5 stars for customer service - thanks for making our stay a good one! :)

Reviews.Title: “No matter over the past 5 years”
Reviews.Author: MiBali21
Reviews.Content: Five years ago I selected this strategically well located spot. Five years later I can't find a black spot about this hotel. Reservation desk checked me in , in a flash. Baggages been instantly teleported to my room. Spacey rooms like at home. The bedding gives me the feeling to sleep,in a cotton stack. I can practice my morning yoga session, get my power breakfast in the room reading my Favourite newspaper and hit a long working day.Wifi is top. Just plug in my ipod on a Bose docking to put my personal ambiance. Ice cube machine on each lobby. The restaurant is magnificent with excellent food presentation.The attention of the room services about details (e.g. my pajama was well folded on the bed when I came back one late evening). Location on one side on the foot of the magnificent MountRoyal and on the other in the middle of the shopping and dinning district. Asia is calling me so back to my favorite warm weather. Thanks SofiTel for the warm stay in the beautiful,but too cold to long Montreal. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: JC64Madeira
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in the center of the city. It is modern style, rooms are OK, my preferred feature being the good Sofitel beds. Internet comes for free. Wardrobe is a bit small. Bathroom features a shower only (room 607) and could use additional shelving for personal items. Service upon check-in was disappointing, only one receptionist to handle both check-ins and check-outs (late morning), while others are in the back handling admin duties instead of handling customers. On the positive side, the complimentary coffee early morning upon check-out is a nice touch. The bar is not very cosy unfortunately and not too inviting for a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “My fave hotel”
Reviews.Author: wittynamehere
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is my favorite hotel. Although small, the Montreal rooms are planned out nicely and have very nice "homey" touches. Is it cheap? NO. But you do get what you pay for. I ONLY stay at Sofitel when in Montreal. Hands down the best. The valet parking is tops.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: msof3
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service, Excellent Location,Close to Mcgill University and downtown. great place to stay!! Rooms are spotless and lovely . The bathrooms are gorgeous and theproducts are fabulous! we have stayed here 6 times and everytime it is a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location--nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDS01
Reviews.Content: Superb location in the heart of downtown Montreal--close to McGill,the mountain,art galleries.Quiet rooms generally well appointed.Good bed.Could use a bit more clothes storage for the price.Good service.Generally a calm quiet experience.Meeting facilities very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbergeron100
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel. It is very modern and nicely decorated. The rooms are small unless yo get the most expensive rooms. The small rooms don't have a bath just a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Bleu, Blanc et Rouge”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Located in the center of Montreal, the Sofitel offers a great hotel experience whether you are there for the culture and charm of Montreal or there for the hockey. Its modern, clean aesthetic is particularly refreshing during a long winter weekend, which is when I have been there, now every year for the last three years. The service is extremely attentive and the rooms are perfect, simple and modern. Renoir, the restaurant has a very good breakfast and a wonderful bar for a late night drink. You can get anywhere in the city from this location: it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Kazouza
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable room and great food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Merveilleux”
Reviews.Author: ErikaMesethSparks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Christmas 2011 and was the best decision we have made. We were treated like queens and kings. All the staff was very professional and extremely polite. A big thank you to all of them. It is so rewarding to see there is still young people so well raised. We felt like being in Europe. A special thank you to Nicholas that served us on Christmas Eve at The Renoir ( one of the most decadent experience we have. The menu was magnificent and the attention, better impossible). We have stayed before at the Sofitel in Rio de Janeiro and we have the same experience. Vive le savoir-faire francais! I was with my two children (22 and 18yo), my husband joined us on the 26th, we tried also the Alexandre restaurant on Avenue Peel, a must, excellent food and very good wine (Reserve Perrin 5, Cotes-du Rhone and Kronenberg 1664 beer = what a luxury) En fin, notre sejour etait inoubliable! Merci beaucoup

Reviews.Title: “Stylish. Well situated. I love this brand.”
Reviews.Author: StephenM465
Reviews.Content: I design hotels for a living. If I could design any brand - this would be it. Great service. Fabulous beds. Outstanding guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Montreal assures comfort”
Reviews.Author: CookieRoxy
Reviews.Content: Central Montreal is the perfect tourist location with museums, restaurants, entertainment, architecture and panoramic views so it is a wonderful location for a hotel. Sofitel, among other hotels, is well located to assure a comfortable and lovely stay and to accommodate your visit to this great city. The service is impeccable, the beds are known for comfort, (Sofitel even boasts the purchase of one of their unique sleeping structures), and the restaurant and bar with cozy terrace offer delicious cuisine. Bravo Sofitel Montreal, which has higher standards than some other Sofitel Hotels around the globe. The rooms are a good size with all the bells and whistles but the windows do not open for fresh air, unfortunately, otherwise the views are great and the hotel is comfortable and assures security and peacefulness.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable place to spend a week”
Reviews.Author: Enid24
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week on business. Everything was perfect - service, rooms and location. Very French and very comfortable - just like the city. Food was exceptional - restaurant and room service. Close walking distance to shopping districts and Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly non-plussed”
Reviews.Author: LoulouEl-H
Reviews.Content: For a French chain, we expected to be a bit impressed by the hospitality but upon arriving, some things were just a little off-putting. For example, the art displays in the otherwise roomy lobby - way too much glossy resin paintings that drown and jar with the stained glass mural. The museum-type showcase displays seem to have been put together by amateurs with a blunt nod to a local jeweller. It continues into the restaurant, Renoir where they put paintings on columns that don't sit well and add nothing to the decor. Another massive flaw is the restaurant's ceiling that has been left in an industrial type of state with exposed lights and utility tracks from the ventilation I suppose. It's a waste of a gloriously high ceiling. This is Montreal and you're within blocks of the museums (a plus, location-wise) but honestly, there's been an oversight in style. The room in spite of a king bed was cramped for two people, and the washroom doors offered no privacy. Overall, the effect was of efficiency, as in ideal for business people in transit, but nothing beyond. The restaurant service was lax, with simple items from our meals missing. Now for the upsides: location was great; valet and garage security were great; front desk was courteous; the luffa as part of the toiletries was a novel touch; the food was adequate. For us, it sadly lacked some oomph. Another visit down the line could prove the first impression wrong, but we're going to wait on that a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Petesyd2204
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mother and on check in we were offered a king room, even though we had booked a twin room. This was no issue and we were quickly moved to a twin room on the penthouse floor. The rooms were excellent and we were provided with complimentary continental breakfast each day. The Sofitel Montreal is up to the standard of other Sofitel's around the world. This hotel felt very inviting and had a nice European feel to it. Our room was a great size, more like a suite. The bathroom was immaculately presented and very clean. It has an awesome shower and I liked the separate tap for your feet. The beds were some of the most comfortable in our 6 week trip around Europe and North America. The hotel is in a great location and it was an easy walk to the Metro station or the shops in the downtown area. The continental breakfast was very nice, getting the individual bread basket and cold cuts, fruit and yogurt. I would have no hesitation to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait till the next stay over”
Reviews.Author: tang-ashby
Reviews.Content: What people truly want from a boutique style hotel is service. This is where the Sofitel shines. We have stayed twice in 3 years and the staff exceeds our expectations consistently. The bar in Renoir is the best hotel lounge we have experienced and when asked where to stay in Montreal our answer is always followed by "of course the Sofitel, where else?"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: erkinToronto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on several occassions while on business in Montreal. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and well appointed and the service is exceptional. Breakfast in the main restautrant off the lobby is wonderful but expensive. The HVAC system is somewhat slow to respond so the room can be too hot or too cold depending upon the current weather.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Summerhill17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sofitel in Montreal many times and it's my favourite in the city by far. The service is excellent and the staff are always welcoming. I've always found the rooms to be great - they vary by size and views but are always clean, fresh and nicely appointed. The only thing I'd like is a coffee maker - although room service is always prompt (if expensive). The bathrooms are modern and rainshowers are great and the beds are very comfortable. The bar area is a perfect place to grab a bite to eat and a glass of wine when travelling alone. I have used their meeting room and food/beverage services and they have always been excellent. Oh - and the location is fabulous! All in all my number 1 hotel in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars”
Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: Didn`t think I would be able to find a hotel at par with the W in Montreal. Different, yes, but as good. The moment I entered the nice lobby, I knew I would enjoy my stay there. The lobby had a good design, and a welcoming atmosphere I haven't seen in many hotels. Location is different than the W, but as good. On Sherbrooke, closed to nice bars, shopping and restaurants. The rooms were a little too classic, but still up to date. I got upgraded to a junior suite, and the bathroom was big. You can choose 2 Internet options: one is free and slower, and the other one is faster, but you have to pay.. If the intend is to take your emails and do basic surfing, the free one is more than adequate.The breakfast at the restaurant was good and affordable for a 5 stars hotel. The gym is a little small an could offer more weights options. Bar is nice, but closes early. The staff was great too, eager to meet your needs efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Little on the expensive side”
Reviews.Author: mprudh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 1 night while visiting Montreal. The room was very impressive and had everything from a rain shower to a flat screen tv and a very comfortable bed. The service was amazing compared to most hotels we've stayed at and they had valet parking which is a must in Montreal. The only down sides was the valet parking was $35 dollars which I found to be quite high for just 1 night. The other down side was the price at the restaurant, I ordered a beer and a glass of cheap wine and cost me $30.00. Breakfast for 2 (eggs, bacon, toast and sausages) costs us $60 with tip for 2 people, again a little high for a breakfast that would cost $20 at Deny's. We do plan on staying at a different hotel during our next visit due to the price of valet and price of food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but the rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: Max_M84
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sofitel Montreal for 3 nights before NYE. The hotel is located close to the Downtown and Fine Arts Museum. Many stores are close by and the St. Cathrine's str. is just a short walk away. The restaurant at the hotel is great as well, same as the general service of the staff. The only thing that could be better was the room size. We found it to be quite tight with all of our luggage there. However to compensate, it offered a great morning view at the Mont Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: natvag
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay there again!!! Comfortable rooms and good service. One bad thing i thought breakfast to be too expensive. We had lots to eat but 250$ for a breakfast of is a bit too much???

Reviews.Title: “great place for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: abrakadabra69
Reviews.Content: hotel is perfectly located in DT of Montreal, rooms are clean, neat, pillows in the hotel not plastic, but goos dawn,for a good nite sleep, and stuff is great and always ready to help you, great food in the restauranti think it's called Le Renoir, was very surprised when they brought the stake and it was perfectly prepared, waitress Jenevieve is the best, has great sense of humor and very charismatic girl , bottom line, you will not regret the stay in Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZZtravels51
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here multiple times and have been very satisfied each time. The bellmen are extremely professional and welcoming as well as the front desk agents who seem to all have significant hospitality training. I've stayed in several different room types throughout the hotel. They are consistently clean and comfortable. I haven't stayed in any rooms that have exceptional views, but if you are high up enough you can get a decent view of the downtown skyline. The beds are extremely comfortable and the amenities in the room are very nice. The bathroom is that of a 5 star hotel each featuring both an immaculate tub and glass stall shower. I have never eaten in their restaurant, but it seems to be mostly a business crowd. All in all, this hotel is a safe bet for good service and good rooms promiently located on Montreal's Golden Mile. If in town for business or pleasure, the Sofitel will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “They are a bit cheap but is an Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anilu77
Reviews.Content: I did not like that they charge me an additional charge for wanting a room with a bath (I know! with this cold weather in Quebec should be mandatory to have a bath!!), so I paid for an upgrade and the room was not as executive, not much change that the normal even w upgrade. My advice : If you are going to pay 200 for a nice hotel u might as well pay 280-300 for a bigger nicer room My negatives: - Room size doesn't really change much even with upgrade - SErvice could be better - I luv when staff want to please the costumer and make all necessary to make sure you get the best possible. - a bit disappointed to be one of the luxury hotels in MTL

Reviews.Title: “They get it right”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay in Montreal approx 30 nights per year - always at Sofitel. Wouldn't stay there unless they get everything right. Even the drinks are served with a compliment of appetizers by people trained to know what good service is and thus do not need confirmation by asking you every 30 seconds "if everything is OK". Price value is unbeatable if you want a luxury hotel without the luxury price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: SPGglobal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group and was very impressed. The rooms are delightful and staff could not have been more helpful. My appalling French was no handicap as staff were happy to humour me and then break into English when it was clear that I was struggling! I was also impressed that the front desk staff and the concierges addressed me by name within a couple of hours of my arrival. The hotel claims that there is a business centre but it is only three PCs in a corner of the lobby with a printer. That said, printing is free so I guess I shouldn't complain as I printed off a to of documents! My one moan would be that there is a mandatory charge for baggage handling when making a group booking, which I understand is part of an union arrangement, but, on our arrival, no one helped with luggage and all my group had to carry their own bags in and up to their rooms. If the unions insist on such a provision, then I feel that they should honour their side of the deal!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Henry1967-09
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sofitel Montreal a few times now and the experience is always good, although I've experienced a few problems. I stayed there in April and I was granted a late check-put at 06.00pm but upon checking out the front desk attempted to charge me an extra because the late check-out was "too late"! I must admit that after presenting my case the whole thing got resolved quickly. My last stay was just a few days ago and, despite being an A-Club Platinum member, I wasn't granted any upgrade, unlike in the past. This said, the hotel is lovely and so are the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AnjVW
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was a nice place to stay during our visit to Montreal. Its location was very convenient and its decor is both modern and welcoming. We arrived late, tired, hungry and rumpled, but from the moment we pulled up in our car, the staff at every turn made us comfortable, which was much appreciated. Our corner room was well appointed but quite small, fine for our brief stay. Our view in one direction was of Mount Royal and the other right into the windows of the apartments across the street so we kept the drapes on that side closed. The bed (king) and linens were the most comfortable of any place we have stayed (and in this day of luxury hotel beds and sleep concierges, that is meant to say a lot). The bathroom was elegant in its design, but did not provide a place for both a shaving kit and makeup case. As one who wakes up early and likes coffee right away, I was disappointed that there was no in-room coffee maker as I find that more convenient than room service. Parking was complimentary but internet access was not. The food in the restaurant and drinks in the bar were very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Mile”
Reviews.Author: Greenlamplady
Reviews.Content: We returned to the wonderful Sofitel on the Golden Mile for what has become an annual visit to Montreal. We were personally welcomed back when checking in, and were given rooms facing west, which offers a great view along Sherbrooke. This lovely hotel has so much to offer. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious, quiet and comfortable - and the feather beds offer a lovely cocoon to curl up in, perfect for chilly November nights. Breakfast in the restaurant is always super - friendly attentive service, a good, varied menu and great atmosphere. Star fruit decorated the rim of a glass of protein drink - a lovely touch. And there are newspapers a plenty from all of the major dailies available. The location of this hotel is second-to-none for browsing galleries and antique shops, and is only a short walk to many fine restaurants and the shopping strip on rue Ste.-Catherine. Simon and his concierge team are still the best I have ever encountered - every request for information or assistance is met with the same smiling attention to detail. They are wonderful !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay. Only quibble is that one is limited to an egg breakfast if the breakfast prepaid option is selected even though there are choices on the menu of equivalent cost. One can select other items but coffee and OJ are then not included.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: asia_traveler_2009
Reviews.Content: In total I spent 5 nights at the hotel in November 2011. It was a wonderful experience. The hotel location is excellent, a few blocks from Rue Sainte Catherine, Montreal's main shopping street and a 20 / 25 minutes walk from the Vieux Port, one of the Montreal's main tourist attraction and Basilica Notre Dame. Rue Sherbrooke itself where the hotel is located is a trendy area of Montreal with luxury shops and nice restaurants. External design of the building is sleek and modern as is the lobby which - but it is a minor point - is not very large. Room decoration is very nice using soft colors and modern furniture. I appreciated the Bose iPod dock as it is always nice to listen your favorite music outside home. Room size in the so called "Superior" rooms is sufficient but some additional square feet wouldn't hurt. The luxury room I occupied during the first 4 nights is much larger and looks like more a junior suite. It corresponds more to the size of teh rooms you expect in a hotel of this category. However, the strongest point of the hotel is undoubtedly the service. Whether it was in-room breakfast (as I had to leave the hotel before the opening of the restaurant), bringing office staples to the room while I was working in it or taking my luggage to the taxi staff was extremely forthcoming and diligent. Everything I requested came extremely rapidly with a smile. Breakfast at the Renoir restaurant is great. It is served at the table with a lot of options and always the same quality of service, efficient and professionalism. Quality of the food served for dinner is also very good. Not only wouldn't I hesitate to recommend the hotel but for sure I will pick it up again for a stay in Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, terrific restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: JB789
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful, with a clean, contemporary look, and its location is excellent - within easy walking distance of a busy downtown area with many restaurants and shopping outlets, and within more ambitious but still walkable distances to such key locations and landmarks as Chinatown, Notre Dame Basilica, Windsor Station, Mont Royal Park, McGill University and many others. The staff was professional, efficient and extremey friendly.Our room, a "Superior", was not large, but beautiful, well-appointed and more than adequate for two; it was in impeccable condition, with tasteful contemporary styling and a floor-to-ceiling window facing out onto the avenue. The bathroom was outfitted with a rain shower, and L'Occitane toiletries were replenished as needed. One minor issue I had with the room was with the way the room safe was built into the closet - the closet was not huge to begin with and the dimensions of the wall safe limited the amount of hanging space for longer items (dresses, fully-hung slacks, etc.), but this was only a minor inconvenience. Another minor issue was that the down comforters, though extremely soft and full, could perhaps use a tighter weave, or be filled with a higher proportion of down vs. feathers, as feathers tended to occasionally poke through, providing a minor nuisance during an otherwise very comfortable time in bed. The fitness center is quite modest, with only a few machines (both weight training and cardio), but it was a beautiful room, impeccably maintained, and well-stocked with towels, bottled water and fresh fruit; it was never crowded, and was more than adequate for our needs . We visited the beautiful Renoir restaurant twice - once for dinner and once for breakfast - both times, we found the the staff extremely friendly and professional, and the food was impeccably prepared and presented. Overall, we loved the hotel, and would return there in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but perhaps a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Martyn W
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better hotels I have stayed in in MontrÃ©al. The staff were very welcoming at reception. I arrived at 10:00am and asked if I could already have my room and they said there would not be a problem. The room was a little small and I have stayed in better 5 star hotels but I would still say it is worthy of the five stars even though at the lower end. I would say for this reason it is slightly overpriced. WIFI was not included in the price which I thought was very poor as the price for 24 hours was about 20 CAD which is astronomical. Fortunately, they had free facilities in reception. It is nicely located in the centre and everywhere is within easy reach. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Modern, Funky”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, hoping to leave our bags at the hotel while we checked out the city. To our surprise we were granted early check-in by the friendly front desk agent. The lobby here is amazing, as per the website photos, and there's always a bowl of apples at the front desk to snack on. We stayed in 1407 which is a corner room with windows on two sides. The decor was contemporary and attractive. There was ample storage with a built-in wall cabinet and drawers under the television. The washroom here is phenomenal... the glass shower is a showpiece, and the even the toiletries are arranged artistically. The gym is well equipped with excellent machines and has washrooms with showers inside for extra convenience. The gym also stocks apples and bottled water. There were only a couple of cons: The rooms don't have a fridge... they come with a stocked minibar instead. The restaurant prices are quite high... $15 oatmeal ? The concierge was very helpful when we asked about visiting the old city, explaining attractions and marking up a map for our use. The hotel has a good location... only a 10-minute walk from St. Catherines St. with shopping along the way. Old Montreal is under a 30-minute walk and has awesome history and architecture. When we checked out the doorman spoke to the taxi driver and advised us that the airport taxi was a flat $38 fee, which was a nice touch since we were charged $48 on the way in lol. This was our first trip to Montreal, as well as our first stay at a Sofitel... and we will definitely revisit both!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient luxury hotel with a fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Brent71
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at a Sofitel before we were not sure what to expect, but we were rewarded with an amazing experience that set the tone for a great Canadian vacation. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Kevin checked us in and was so warm and friendly we felt honored to be staying here. The room was wonderful and the bathroom quite nice and modern. The bed was very comfortable and was a treat after long days of walking around the city. The hotel location can not be beat as many things are close as are a couple of Metro stops. The Sofitel is truly a luxury, upscale hotel that we felt was a good value as well. The location, staff and room quality were all top notch. We are definitely fans and will be looking for Sofitels in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Merci!!”
Reviews.Author: Lickerishtheclown
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a modern, clean and friendly staff, this is it. Affordable and easy access to stores. Room was a little small but was only needed for sleeping. Beautiful bathroom. thank your for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfy room”
Reviews.Author: blackfriday1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night here at Sofitel. It was a very good location. Room was a bit small but well equipped. The bathroom was modern and the bedding was comfy. Staffs were friendly, valet staffs were super helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and QUIET stay...”
Reviews.Author: RockiesExpert
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Montreal earlier this month, and picked the Sofitel due to its location and reputation. We weren't disappointed. I recommend, however, that you get a higher floor facing the east side of the hotel if you're a light sleeper. Our room the first night was on the northwest corner of the 6th floor. Noise was noticeable from here, so the hotel staff moved us up to the 15th floor on the northeast corner. That made all the difference in the world. We then slept soundly on a great Sofitel bed. Breakfast isn't included, and we didn't try the hotel restaurant. Instead, I recommend Universel within walking distance of the hotel. They have great breakfast, especially the crepes. Parking isn't included either and is pricey at about $30 per night. However, all of Montreal is expensive for parking, so I don't know what can be done to lower the cost. All in all, the Sofitel hotel has great service, comfy and modern rooms, and a great location. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara-Grace P
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Sofitel on Sherbrooke St. West for a family wedding from Oct. 8-11/2011. The staff were classy & professional, and anglophone-friendly. The rooms were very modern yet warmly appointed; the beds very very comfortable, and the bathroom luxurious. We were within easy walking distance of galleries, restaurants, retail, and the wedding venue. The brunch served the day after the wedding ina private dining room was first class food/beverage & superb service. We would stay at the Sofitel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Sofitel Hotels”
Reviews.Author: SeanKStewart
Reviews.Content: Visited Montreal for the first time and booked a room for the weekend at the Sofitel Montreal. From the moment we arrived the service was superb from the valet to the front desk staff. We received two glasses of champagne and some nice fruit slices from the bar. The room featured windows from floor to ceiling, offered a very nice bathroom with shower and tub and an extra comfy bed providing a great nights rest. This is the only Sofitel in Canada. It is a complete makeover of a former office building located on Rue Sherbrooke in an excellent central location. Don't miss out on walking to Old Montreal or Parc Du Mont Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thea123
Reviews.Content: We were on the 16th floor, one floor below the penthouse suite and top floor. This hotel did modern right! Our room was immaculate, the bed and bedding exceptional and the room spacious and more than comfortable. It is centrally located, in walking distance of downtown center and old town. There were many tv channles in both english and french which is nice in Quebec and we had free wifi. Service was impeccable. The only suggestion would be to include a coffee maker/tea prep in the room. Stay in this hotel. It is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JourneysFromSeattle
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed staying in Sofitel hotels in the U.S. and Asia and found the service at the Sofitel Montreal to be exceptional. The staff are extremely well trained professionals who are friendly, gracious and attentive. The rooms are comfortable, though our room was quite small - perhaps we should have paid closer attention when we booked our room. The bathroom was really nicely appointed, with tasteful tilework and a shower with an overhead rain shower head. I am sensitive to noise at night and our room was very quiet and I noticed the shades were designed to help block out the maximum of light. Terrific. In the evenings, we received nice recommendations from the concierge for dinner. We usually started with a drink in the bar -served with complimentary tasty snacks, which one evening included a nicely presented, delicious crab spring roll. After several nights out at more formal restaurants, we were in the mood for something very casual where it would be appropriate to dress in jeans. Since we had heard about local comfort food called poutine, we asked for recommendations for locations to have great 'poutine' - a dish that consists of French Fries topped with a tasty pepper gravy, and cheese curds. You can also order special toppings - one of which included chopped steak with mushrooms and onion. Sounds like a heart attack on a plate, and it is....but totally worth it!!!! We loved it! I think it speaks incredibly well of the range of a great concierge to be able to recommend the very best of dining options at the top end and sometimes, AND when the mood strikes you, more humble, comfort-food type establishments. We had a ball! Cold beers and all! If there were any criticism of the hotel, it would be the valet/front door service. On three separate mornings, I stepped out of hotel, dressed professionally for a day of work/conferences. Each day it was raining heavily. On each occasion the narrow driveway was awkwardly blocked by a car or taxi. While there were only two or three other guests waiting, the attendant (in full uniform with a hat - i.e. the guy in charge) completely ignored me. No 'Bon jour', no apology for delay, and no offer to call a cab. I quickly learned that the cabs wait at the corner to the right of the entrance and started getting my own cabs. Given the terrific service at this hotel, I was surprised to get ignored at the entrance even though I was a guest. A small irritation, but an important detail since these are the first and last impressions. Again, we had a terrific stay, based on my stay at the Sofitel Montreal, I will continue to seek out and recommend stays at the Sofitel Properties.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to pay for parking!”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was incredibly friendly, the location was great, and the place was clean. On the negative side, it had some burst pipes prior to our arrival and we were the first guests to re-enter the space. Our carpet was a bit damp. In their defense they offered us a new room, but we stayed since it didn't smell. Everything else was absolutely clean, and the view was great. They don't tell you that you must pay to park until you're checking out. Not cool. It wasn't cheap. The restaurant has great food, but with that comes price! Overall a good experience and I'd recommend going if you don't mind paying a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a romantic long-weekend”
Reviews.Author: StratusCouple
Reviews.Content: First time staying at a Sofitel. We once dined at the Sofitel in Lisbon, Portugal, and always wanted to try the hotel. We went as a long weekend to celebrate my fiance's birthday. The hotel was very easy to find, although the traffic in downtown Montreal is horrendous. We valet parked, which was a luxury, but worth it. The hotel is right downtown on Sherbrooke, walking distance from the metro, and all the shopping. Old Montreal is a good 45 minute walk. We took the metro most places that were too far to walk. The hotel was spotless, quiet, felt luxurious, and the service was excellent. Our room was nice, a bit small, but the bathroom was amazing. We loved the rain shower. No complaints, and would most likely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: I sampled a few hotels on a recent trip to Montreal, the Sofitel for the business part of the trip and the Hilton Garden Inn and Holiday Inn for the leisure elements. The hotel is in a good location - accesible on Sherbrooke, a block from the subway which leads into the massive underground maze of shops and cafes, and just along from McGill University. Check in was slick and the agents attentive. The room was cozy. As I was on a two week trip, there was not really enough room to store all my stuff but I was creative and fitted it all in. The room was clean, looked reasonably new and had a via onto Sherbrooke. The bed was very comfortable, with an easy to use iPod dock adjacent. I don;t think I turned on the TV once, and there was turndown service each evening. The bathroom was also compact, and one needed to remember to pull the blinds as it had big windows onto Sherbrooke. There was only a shower which was a repetitive them on this trip - I like a good soak in the tub but the majority of hotels on this trip offered only showers. But it was clean, with fluffy towels and L'Occitane toiletries. I only drank in the bar, but colleagues ate, and whilst they said the food was good, it was expensive. The only challenge I had was the air-con (as always) which would not go below 21'C. I logged this at reception, and whilst I was out the room was turned into the freezer I wanted! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FerrariWidow
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on Sherbrooke, just around the corner from the Peel Metro stop, and just blocks from McGill and at the base on Mount Royal. We found the service excellent, whether it was the front desk and valets, the room service and housekeeping staff; we felt no request was too much to ask. The room service menu was complete and thorough ( my husband is one for ordering snacks to the room) which kept us out of the well stocked mini bar. There was in room (through the TV) internet, Bose radio with docking station and L'Occitane bath products, even robes and slippers for our stay. we we definitely stay here again when in Montreal. A short 10-15 minute walk to Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinystar1300
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - very clean rooms new furniture etc. although the food was not exceptional. Room service was ordered and it was not very warm - it also took quite a while. The bar area is also extremely expensive for what it is. Cocktails ~ $22 for nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel that lived up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: Aled_Vic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here and loved it. Although it's 20 mins walk from Old Montreal, it's 2 minutes walk from Parc Mont-Royale, and close to shops and great restaurants. Our room was a typical European size so to some it may be small, but it was in great condition. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff etc. All I would expect from a 4* and what was on the small luxury hotels of the world list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: biztravlr345 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location on Sherbrooke that is close to main attractions. Rooms are very functional, comfortable and nicely decorated. Base level rooms are on the small side for a hotel of this calibre. Service is great without being over the top or pretentious. Overall ambience is understated luxury. Highly recommended for both business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: COhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: I love Sofitels elsewhere (D.C. is wonderful), so thought we'd splurge in Montreal and stay in a French hotel. We should have trusted the rating on Trip Advisor but foolishly did not. Bad: 1- We entered our "luxury" room and it smelled horribly of smoke. Unless you didn't have a nose, it was noticeable so why didn't they make efforts to get rid of it? They finally "found" another room for us which looked the same: what I would compare to a nice Hilton. 2- The Sofitels bathrooms are always high end with marble throughout, but this entire room, including the bathroom, was just dated, not to mention dull and dark. It needs to get an upgrade and ditch the black 1980s decor. Even little touches could be cheaply attended to, such a making sure the bed frame isn't visible and properly placing the bed skirt. 3- It was a birthday celebration and they did nothing special and comped nothing. They have turndown service which only includes closing the curtains. 4- The concierge was very shifty. For example, for an authentic breakfast, he sent us to a very poor chain (Eggspectations). Really? He acted annoyed and burdened by our educated questions and tried to just brush us off. Instead, use the tourist place at Dorchester Square because they are free and wonderful. 5- They have wifi, but it is only free for one day. Good: 1- The Doorman Dominic (all of them, really) and their adorable top hats were always fun. 2- The location is fine. It is walkable to shopping and some tourist stops. Summary: Some locals we ran into said, "ugh, that sofitel has really went downhill recently." They, and I, recommend somewhere nicer with a more central location like St. James. If this place didn't cost an arm and leg, my review wouldn't be so harsh.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very comfortable hotel... we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: annied01
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the attentiveness and pleasant attitude of all the staff we came into contact with. The room was beautifully put together. The bed, a very comfy king bed and with a feather bed to boot! We were altogether totally delighted with our room. Barely a sound heard from the hallway except the slamming of other guest's doors on occasion but we have had much worse elsewhere. We slept beautifully for a full 10 hrs and are light sleepers so it was very quiet. We thought the bathroom and complimentary products were very nice: the loofah, and all the extras left for us plus we could hardly believe there was a Bose wave sound system in the room... Very nice to have with our iPod. The breakfast included next morning was the nicest Continental we have ever had: boilled 3 minute egg, fresh fruit salad, slices of brie, swiss, ham, salami, plus baguette, croissant and 2 other pastries each served in a basket. Fresh orange juice and coffee or teas brought in a proper pot or Bodum. In fact we will definitely be repeat guests and gave the hotel 5 even if there was one thing missing: there was no coffee-maker or tea supplies in the room... Other than that we had absolutely no complaints. It is easy walking distance to the Montreal Museum of FIne Arts and the whole area around Crescent street and very convenient for the underground transit or bus.

Reviews.Title: “This was our first visit to Montreal, but it wonâ€™t be our last and when we return, we will stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Frank F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of being guests at the Sofitel Montreal Le Carre Dore from august 23 to August 27, 2011. During our stay, we received excellent service from all staff members, without exception. The hotel itself is beautiful with a handsome lobby and attractive artwork throughout. Our room was beautifully decorated and maintained perfectly by the Housekeeping Department. Meals in the on-site Renoir Restaurant were a culinary delight and the service staff made us feel right at home as did the personnel in the Lounge. We were especially impressed by the positive attitudes and willingness to assist demonstrated by all of the hotel associates. This was our first visit to Montreal, but it wonâ€™t be our last and when we return, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The best beds of the world!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: petrus18465
Reviews.Content: Sofitel have the best beds of the industry, excellent restaurant and for anybody that have problems to sleep, they should try Sofitel. I slept more that 8 hours. Good service and attention!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it...”
Reviews.Author: travelinghubby0
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is down the street from McGill University. Great concierge, nice decor, comfy rooms. Didn't eat here, so I don't know about the quality of the food. They provide free wi-fi for only 24hours. That I didn't like so much. You have a BIX bicycle rack right across the street from the hotel, which makes it easy to get up early and bike all over Montreal, which is awesome by itself. I would say the down fall is it's in more of a business district, about 1 mile from St. Lurainte (sp) street, which is the spot for dinner, dancing, and other stuff. So, the area didn't have a lively vibe to it on the evenings besides students passing to their dorms.It wasn't a major obstacle or deal breaker, just an observation. Old Montreal was about 30 mins away walking. I would definitely stay again though. Pretty good for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreatFalls-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just a lovely Hotel. Nice restaurant, great rooms, nice central location. I liked all of it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: danny l
Reviews.Content: I am a former Montrealer now living in TO. This hotel is amazing, staff was professional. We got a suite and it was to die for because of my wife was so pleased so it was a really pleasant weekend. I will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that meets the usual high Sofitel standards”
Reviews.Author: Hunter-Gather Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Because the hotel is well located in a bustling section of downtown Montreal a few blocks from McGill University, once we turned over our automobile to the valet, we didn't need to use it again until we checked out. As vegetarians, this entailed some some half hour to forty minute walks to restaurants, but we didn't mind as the area was attractive and the weather very pleasant. The hotel itself was immaculate, and the staff attentive and helpful. The only glitch arose with our breakfast package which caused some minor consternation in the restaurant, but was quickly taken care of at the front desk upon checkout. Sofitel Hotels can be a bit pricey at times, but if you examine their packages and book carefully you can often get more than your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel was grand!”
Reviews.Author: yhuoh
Reviews.Content: Pros: Got a really good deal at ~$170/night with taxes included; lobby was gorgeous; the room was spacious and beautiful; bed was super comfy; bathroom was a good size; room also provided everything one could need (ie amazing toiletries and plenty of towels); front desk and concierge were incredibly nice --provided umbrellas on a stormy day; hotel is in a great location! Cons: very trivial but bed did not come with top sheet (not sure if this is a Quebec thing); on the last day the room service was sub-par (glasses and ice bucket were not replaced/cleaned); had issues with the free wifi internet access the entire time but front desk was quick to assist

Reviews.Title: “McGill parent's first choice”
Reviews.Author: danholl
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time staying in that hotel and we are always happy. If you have a student studying at Mc Gill university, the location is ideal. The rooms are very clean-looking and spacious. The smaller rooms are large enough. The decoration is identical in all the rooms, and so is the painting on the wall above the bed (a flower vase painted by the daughter of the hotel architect David Azrieli). The bathroom has all the amenities, is modern and nicely decorated. The service is kind and very good. If you plan to bring your child down to the University at the end of August, book in advance and you will have much better deals!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tsahai85
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to go to Montreal for the weekend before the grind of back to work started again. We had initially booked the St.James but after reading the reviews, we decided to save money and book the Sofitel. We were not disappointed. The hotel is ideally located as we were able to walk to Simons, (I LOVE Simons) many restaurants and St. Catherine easily from the hotel. Check in was smooth and efficient and also pleasant. The room was lovely (if a little cold) and the beds were soft. The bathroom was clean with great amenities. We did not eat at hotel as there are too many places to try in Montreal (at the moment Juliet et Chocolat is my new favorite love - pear and dulce de leche crepe yyyuuuuummmmm). Anything we needed the hotel provided including umbrellas and adapters. Really NOTHING to complain about and free internet is a great bonus in this day and age. We would stay here again without question!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: travel_divaNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of great restaurants and sights. Old Montral isn't a far walk either. The hotel is top notch and the beds are plush and comfy. This is a great place to stay in Montreal and it's walking distance from Mont Royal Park as well!

Reviews.Title: “Fair.”
Reviews.Author: swiss_mamacita2
Reviews.Content: We liked the location Downtown. The rooms were nothing fancy, not very new anymore, but clean and everything worked fine. We didnt like the breakfast though, service was slow and didnt pay attention to our wishes. I had asked for a continental breakfast without charcuterie but it come with. My boyfriend asked for bread with his omelette that never came, although the waitress had confirmed back the order. The coffee was not very exciting either and we thought that the orange juice wasnt fresh. What we liked however, was the bar in the hotel where they serve nice drinks accompanied by nuts, olives and japanese crackers. The drinks were excellent, we had a rasperry mojito, actually a lot of them! That was not on the menu, but recommended by the waitress. There is free Wifi throughout the hotel that worked very well at all times. We liked the suggestions from concierge Virginia about restaurants and were to walk around. We had a good deal with three nights for the price of two and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property and service”
Reviews.Author: MWM317
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was extremely impressed with the hotel. Our package included an upgrade to a junior suite, and complimentary valet parking (AAA membership) Our room on the 17th floor was simply beautiful, quiet and well appointed. Floor to ceiling windows, comfortable bed and high quality (L'Occitane) bath products along with the nicely finished and decorated room made for a wonderful vacation. Everything about our stay, from the maid service, to the parking valets and concierge staff was well above expectations. The hotel is in a great downtown location and is convenient to activities that we drove to such as the Rogers Cup, Ovarium Spa and Jean-Talon market. These activities could also be reached via the Metro. Great shopping and restaurants are all within close walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel. While the cost is higher than many hotels in the area, the value that it offered was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Uptown luxury”
Reviews.Author: Greenlamplady
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel became THE place to stay when the Ritz-Carlton closed for renovation/conversion. The Sofitel is a superb hotel. The service is impeccable. The rooms have a boutique feel to them and are a good size. The bed we had was wonderful, with a down mattress cover and super light duvet and large down-filled pillows...it was very hard to get up in the morning! You can actually purchase all of the beddings so you can create the same sleep experience in your own home. The concierge team at this hotel is among the best I have ever encountered anywhere. No question was too mundane; they had suggestions on what to do on Sunday afternoons in the city, and their restaurant recommendations were all excellent. They do breakfast very well here, and seem to cater to business people from the area. The hotel is situated within easy walking distance of many attractions like the Museum of Fine arts and small art galleries and antique shops. TIP: If you have the time, book the 4 nights for the price of 3 offer.

Reviews.Title: “we had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: zimme3
Reviews.Content: great hotel with excellent service. we have stayed at several Sofitel properties and they are consistently exceptional from Rio to Montreal. highly recommend this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: co_native29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Montreal for the first time to visit his sister and brother in-law. We choose Sofitel due to a special being offered through expedia. Location: Perfect, this is a great location, close to a lot of shopping and restaurants. You could even walk to Old Montreal if you are ambitious. It is also close to Mont Royal which is a great park to hike and walk around. Service: Everyone at this hotel was so helpful and welcoming. Rooms: The rooms are gorgeous, clean with very comfortable beds. The bathroom is nice with very modern features. The big windows offered a great view of Montreal. Overal: Would definitely return to this hotel next time I visit Montreal. I can't imagine a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and attention to small details.”
Reviews.Author: Daninwa
Reviews.Content: I've been to a lot of my hotels in my travels and this one would be one of the best I've ever been to. I have a hard time understanding how anyone could give a fair much less a poor or terrible, and I say this as someone who is picky about where I will stay. The staff is very helpful and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Small details are thought of such as providing bottled water every night and candles in the beautiful bathroom. I had one of the smaller rooms, but it's plushness and comfort excused the smaller size. Plus I was traveling alone so I didn't need a grand room. :)

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Montcalm
Reviews.Content: We go to Montreal very often and when we stay overnight our first hotel of choice is the Sofitel. We've stayed here more nights over the past five + years then I can count, the most recent being in May - and I have to say that its been consistently a great experience. This hotel is up to what you expect of a Sofitel - high quality - great service. The service and staff are wonderful - they are always welcoming and happy to help. They take note of any comments for improvements and when you have a question or require special help they are very accommodating. Something I've noticed is the low turnover (at least in the front of the house staff) - this typically indicates that its a good place to work and maybe one of the reasons why staff are so friendly.. Rooms - most recently we stayed in a regular room - but over the years we've stayed in all levels of rooms - my favourite, though a bit on the small side, are the corner rooms - loads of windows and nice views. Actually the floor to ceiling windows offer great city views regardless of what room your in - although you may want to ask for a room facing either the Mountain or Sherbrooke St. W. on the east side of the hotel there is a condo/office building and views are therefore limited. Junior suites are beautiful - bathroom is amazing! Amenities are excellent - good quality Occitane products. The hotel is constantly upgrading - recently they've been replacing the carpeting - but I think its probably time they started replacing some of the furniture (chairs/sofas) - the upholstery is starting to look a bit "worn". Beds are extremely comfortable as is bedding. Restaurant - we have not had dinner at Renoir as there are so many choices in Montreal and we like trying new places outside the hotel - but breakfasts are wonderful and worth it to take the b&b option. Service in the restaurant is as good as elsewhere in the hotel - again no issues ever. The bar is a good place for a pre-dinner drink. They offer valet parking - which while a bit expensive (but comparable to other similar hotels in Montreal) is worth it ...we've never had an issue. . Its a great location for visiting Montreal - you can take the Metro to Old Montreal (we walk in the summer), Museum of Fine Arts is three blocks over, great shopping all around, wonderful choice of restaurants/clubs, etc. Highly recommend this hotel - the minor points I mentioned have not in any way affected our experience ...no hotel can be absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite at Sofitel Standards”
Reviews.Author: Dsdsdsds
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, but I had 2 pre paid hotel rooms arranged through the Sofitel Web Site for 4 nights. At check out they claimed only one room was pre paid and the account needed to be settled prior to our departing. Both rooms were on prior month charge card. Front desk clerk claimed to be most senior person and not helpful. When we checked back in 3 days later shower drain overflowing at midnight and took them an hour to find new room. Not Sofitel Philly or Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelerreviews
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights. Beautiful room. Great bathroom with l'occitane toiletries a real plus. Good service all around. No buffet breakfast but a la carte which was OK. Internet access outrageously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay one of few downtown Montreal hotels that didnt report bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: MISSPICO
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay to go to school and I was using tripadvisor reveiws to follow up on any reports of bedbugs from other travellers at hotels and also i call to follow up with front desk and housekeeping at all hotels now before booking.I was completly upset to see that a majority of hotels downtown were having bedbug reports , I almost cancelled my trip and than remembered the sofitel and thought i would give them a look. I found nothing online and than the staff and housekeeping assured me that they have never had any problems with bedbugs and have never had to spray for them . I was feeling at ease with this and booked my hotel room for 10 days and enjoyed my trip there , i love the neighbourhood that the hotel is in and how close it is to everything downtown . It was a nice classy place , i didnt eat there much but did enjoy what i did eat , i have favorites in the city that i eat at ,the staff was helpful and friendly . only once did i have a maid come on in to my room when i had the private sign on but i can get over that , They do have a strong policy on changing the sheets and checking the rooms daily , because i was so busy i did not even sleep there all the nights so i did not need them to attend to my room that day . The layout of my room was beautiful and felt like home and i loved the bathroom it was very pretty , my bed was big and comfortable and i enjoyed my stay . would go back thank you to everyone at the sofitel and i commend you for your high standards about bed bugs and for being one of the few hotels that care and reconize this problem that is ongoing in the world today. big thank you from me :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: off2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Spacious room, including the bathroom. Comfy beds and great staff. The restaurant terrance is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: notfrequentflier
Reviews.Content: We flew up on Friday morning and stayed until Sunday. The room was as expected: clean, modern and convenient. We upgraded to a mini suite, which was a no brainer for the incremental cost. The staff are very friendly but professional. The hotel is within walking distance of the shopping and restaurant areas. We didnt have a bad meal in this town. At the suggestion of the concierge, we went to a great breakfast place in the olde part of the town. The weather was beautiful. The people in the town were friendly and young. Great town.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: pikapp8
Reviews.Content: I am diamond and platinum in Marriott and Hilton and have only stayed at Sofitel a handful of times. This hotel surpasses any of the other hotel chains and I don't hold any elite status at this chain. The staff is extremely friendly and treat everyone as important as a top tier guest. My room was a corner room and had a very nice shower and a Bose wave radio system. Internet was $15 per 24 hrs and room service was efficient. The hotel gym was very nice and updated and it is centrally located to St Catherine, Peel, and anywhere else you'd like to be in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel but multiple service glitches”
Reviews.Author: travelerdocmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in two rooms (next door but not connected) on a family discount date. Attractive hotel with very comfortable, attractive rooms, but no pool and mediocre exercise room. When we checked in, the person at the front desk failed to review the rate or remind me that it included free breakfast for the children. After breakfast cost well over $100 for 4 the first day, the second day, we went somewhere else, and only after re-checking my hotel confirmation the second night, we returned to the restaurant for our final breakfast-interstingly, only after my husband asked about children, we got a 50% discount on their meals (something we were not offered the first day-inconsistent service). We also had trouble with the key cards-they only worked intermittently, and when they stopped working after we returned exhausted from a long walk in nearby Parc du Mont Royal, the woman at the front desk was not apologetic-in fact she blamed me, saying it was from having the key card near my cell phone and credit cards (which were in the hotel safe. . . nowhere near the key card). That evening, we had difficulty watching an On Demand movie-we experienced about an hour of a comedy of errors-someone came to fix the movie but it still didn't work, and when we switched to our other room, the tv didn't work. Finally, we got the movie working and the manager sent free popcorn and drinks-a nice gesture, but I can't believe we were charged for the movie! One last issue was that the concierge had agreed to arrange to have our car washed (for $50), but when we checked out, the car was still filthy. I complained to the manager at check out, and she was sweet and apologetic but did not adjust the bill. In the end, the free popcorn and drinks were all we got for a lot of service issues. They also did remove the charges for the kids' breakfasts at check out. The rooms were very comfortable, and we liked the location, but Montreal has a lot of nice hotels, and unless they offer us a free night or comparable perk on our next stay, we'll go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylist hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaRyanOrange
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a last minute trip to Montreal last weekend and stayed at the Sofitel on Sherbrooke Street, which is situated in the middle of the so-called Golden Mile of Montreal. The area is a mix of nice hotels, office towers, good restaurants, and shopping. Of all the places we visited in Montreal we liked our location the best. Our room was a superior, which is an upgrade from their standard room. The upgrade was worth the extra few dollars to have the extra space and a higher floor. We had the Picnic package that included--guess what--a picnic? We took ours to go, but if you want to have a picnic during your stay the hotel supplies a picnic basket and suggested picnic locations. We had a choice of salads, sandwiches, and a bottle of red or white wine. Cookies, apples, and granola bars rounded out our feast. The lobby and guest rooms are super chic without being bare or stark. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and they switch from French to English depending on their guests first language. Our only suggestion is that the Sofitel give guests access to free WiFi in their rooms. It always amuses us to see that Red Roof Inns have free WiFi and breakfasts and five-star hotels don't. What is the story here? Why? Nevertheless, we would definitely stay here again. The hotel is located just a block away from good restaurants, McGill University, and two top museums. Young people can walk the few blocks to Crescent Street to find all kinds of "happening" bars and night spots. Tips: Visit the old town of Montreal, but don't sleep there--it is not the real Montreal. Consider taking the 3-hour Greyhound bus tour of Montreal to get an overview of the city and then revisit the areas that are of interest to you. Sorry Montreal--we went our of our way to try Fairmont Bagel, but we still prefer NYC bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Jillboo
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here for the weekend of the U2 concert, and we were very pleased. Location is excellent, and we walked everywhere. Enjoyed shopping and excellent cuisine close by. Walked to McGill as well. Used taxi for Old Montreal, purchased last minute tickets to Cirque de Soleil with assistance of concierge. Room nicely appointed, pet friendly, and quiet. Love L'occitane products. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially ?Elgin. Room was very clean and bed extremely comfortable. Would definitely visit again in beautiful July weather.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Montreal, maybe even favorite five star in Canada”
Reviews.Author: LeaHB333
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend stay at the Sofitel in Montreal. I have stayed at almost every hotel in Montreal, and I believe my search is over! We checked in early, and threw them a curve by staying an extra night unplanned. I thought the hotel handled both really well, our rooms weren't ready yet so we had a drink at the bar (best hendricks martini I ever had), and by the time we had our rooms they had worked out the issue of us staying an extra night, at a really busy time for the hotel, very impressive. The service just got better and better! The junior suites were spacious, and had the very best bathroom of any of the hotels I have stayed at with, two sinks, a separate area for bath and shower, with two showwer heads (a rain and a handheld shower). The restarant Renoir was a treat with really tasty food, you have got to try the shrimp cocktail, it's huge and has the most flavorful sauce. The chicken salad was awesome as well. I travel a lot for family and business and have found my new favorite hotel in Montreal. I will be staying there every time I travel to Montreal from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BronxNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We just came home from 3 nights in Montreal at the Sofitel. Great hotel, centrally located, wonderful service and a really great concierge who helped us many times with sightseeing tips, dinner suggestions and managed to arrange a dinner cruise for us on Wed. night when there are fireworks on the St. Lawrence River. This hotel provided maid service twice a day both morning and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place but not a 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Pacifici
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Golden Mile for a night. The place is fine but does not meet standards for other 5 stars hotels. It's not that's it's bad, it's just that the hotel is just "not there yet" in terms of luxury, feel. It looks like the Sofitel was set into a building built for a Holiday Inn. The good -Upon arrival, we were very pleasantly greeted and we were feeling very much welcomed -Check-in was easy and we were up to our "luxury room" on the 9th floor. -The bed smells clean and the sheets are crisp. -Lotion and shampoo are from L'Occitane which is a nice touch -Very nice location, near all services in downtown Montreal -Check-out is at noon, contrary to other places asking guests to leave for 11:00am. The bad -Carpet in lifts were dirty -Much wasted space in the room and instead of small straight up chair they could have put a sofa. -Water escapes from the shower (underneath the door) which means that there is water on the marble floor, despite the shower mat (which cannot absorb all of the water) - very very slippery! -Beds are extra extra extra soft (and, of course, we prefer hard mattresses...) So, essentially, the hotel if fine but in this price range (i.e. over $235/night), we believe there are better choices in Montreal. Maybe it just didn't click between the Sofitel and us....

Reviews.Title: “A delight”
Reviews.Author: Rowie1
Reviews.Content: Smart door staff, wonderful reception team who went the extra mile for anything you might ask, housekeeping terrific! Room - large and deluxe. Bed - the most comfortable I've slept in for a very long time, Bose micro soundsystem/alarm. Bathroom - beautiful. Really nice little touches like a candle, extensive range of bathroom accessories, and.......fluffy towels!! The only thing that let the hotel down at all was the service in the restaurant - it was consistently poor, with forgotten orders, slow service and billing errors. The hotel was so good, it seems a real shame the restaurant can't keep the same standard. Having said that, there are many other excellent restaurants in the area to choose from. Definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best thing in Montreal! Wonderful hotel and knowledgeable concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Mumbailing
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Montreal is located in the heart of downtown, close to many eateries. As we were on holiday, we took our time (half hour) to walk to Old Montreal. This was nice because we passed by St Catherine's (shopping) and Chinatown. The room was very comfortable, with a bed that you don't want to crawl out of in the morning, and a washroom that's decked out with great amenities and a wonderful shower area. Plus, it's super sparkling clean! What's most remarkable about this hotel is its concierge service! They are so helpful, kind and knowledgeable. They are the people you want and need when you have questions in your head - "what's the best restaurant to go to? how best to make use of your day?" The concierge managed to squeeze us into Montreal's best 'Au Pied de Cochon', which is almost impossible as this restaurant has a long waiting list. Bravo Sofitel Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: xumere500
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were lucky enough to find a room during the Jazz Festival. The location was great because itâ€™s near the art museum, art galleries, and shops. Our standard room was clean, modern, and had an exquisite bathroom. Guillaume, who brought our luggage, was very helpful and pleasant. The parking attendants were extra helpful when I left my mobile phone in the car and they retrieved it for me. Housekeeping stopped by every day to check in on us. Simon, the concierge, was able to assign us a room with a nice view, gave us great advice on how to navigate through the city, and recommendations on where to go and what to do. Our vacation was so much more perfect at the French Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Cpretto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to the McGill University Campus in the heart of downtown. You are only a few blocks to shopping on St. Catherine's or nightlife on Crescent or St. Laurent. In addition you are only a few blocks away from the trail leading to the top of Mount Royal - one of the best tourist destinations in Montreal. The service was excellent and on par with what you should expect from the Sofitel chain. Rooms were a bit small, but overall an excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “A smart hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Tallys
Reviews.Content: You will find genuine service here with quality and attention to detail that very few hotels are able to maintain. The excellent standard of service is without the doubt the core of the hotel. The rooms are very well presented the Sofitel beds envelop you with comfort securing an excellent nights sleep. Then there is breakfast which is an absolute delight which one must savour. So get up early and don't rush. Naturally the hotel is located close to various shopping malls bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Choice location, good room, friendly staff but administrative failings”
Reviews.Author: Felix0309
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits from a central location. The external architecture is pleasing but, lounge apart, the ground floor is a design flop. Access from the hotel to the combined bar-resto area, and through to the summer terrace, is by one door. The terrace, with its plastic chairs (at these prices !) veers between bar and resto. Staff were friendly. Check-in was form-free (but see below), and the employee came from behind his desk to show me to the lift. My room was well-furnished and appointed, as was the bathroom. I appreciated the morning sunshine, the bedside reading light and the turn-down service. The pricing of food and drink is opaque. The impression is given that if you have to ask the real price, you should not be staying at the Sofitel Montreal. The room menu indicates that taxes, service and delivery are addditional, without specifying. Is this legal ? The mini-bar pricing is silent on additional charges. In the resto, the breakfast menu indicates,for example, a continental breakfast at CAD22 which according to my internet booking becomes CAD32. I decided to give the breakfast a try if the Financial Times was available - but it was not.(New York and Washington had a plentiful supply). CHIC PICNIC - this summer offering bears little relation to the publicity. While sandwich and salad were in the hamper, the 'delicious' pastries and fresh fruits were replaced by nibbles and M&M sweets. Instead of champagne or wine, plus soft drinks and bottled water, there was one small bottle of water. The hotel was in a complete muddle over the wine. As I took the picnic in my room before late check-out, I was not too bothered but if I was the romantic couple on the flyer, I would be pretty annoyed. The conditions of my Accor gold card were respected. At check-in I was welcomed back, which was destabilising as I have never been in Canada before. The hotel thought I was from Alberta. Despite trying to correct this, I was presented at check-out with a bill with an address in Alberta (plus my home street added to one line). I have googled this address, and a namesake does live there, and it is easy to deduce he works for a near-by oil company. At least I got my points...The same sort of thing happened in Sofitel Melbourne and New York (but no points). New York had a Melbourne suburb address for me (another namesake). Sofitel should really sort this out because of the legal and privacy implications of guests being wrongly identified.

Reviews.Title: “Felt as wonderful as home”
Reviews.Author: torontogirl5
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel after a disappointing stay at another property. This hotel was lovely. The room is nicely appointed and quiet. For a comfortable, relaxing stay this hotel tops the mark. I loved the bathroom with its luxurious tub, beautiful separate shower and the spaciousness of the room. Yes, it is pricier than the usual Delta's, Marriott's etc. however it is the most comfortable hotel I've stayed at in Montreal. It's central location is nice on Sherbrooke street and everything you could want is nearby. This hotel has my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - we were treated very well.”
Reviews.Author: TeamTimmer
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Montreal and we were very much looking forward to it. Sofitel Montreal pleasantly surprised us upon our arrival by giving us an upgrade (we were guests of the day apparently). This was fabulous, however it was actually the staff that impressed us. They were courteous, extremely helpful and supportive of us (we are travelling with an 11 month old). For example, housekeeping were very good about coming to clean around our son's sleeping schedule and were always very prompt whenever we had a request. It must also be said that the bathroom in our room was beautiful and the hotel has a very pleasant terrace adjacent to it its restaurant. The hotel is also conveniently located. We will choose to stay here again, whether travelling for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “It's said to be the best in the city....it didn't disappoint....”
Reviews.Author: TheGeez
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend....I really can't fault the place in terms of rooms,cleanliness, staff service, food , ambiance ,bar , location,,,,It really has it all. Yes it's not the cheapest place out there,,,but then it is meant to be the best hotel. Prime location on Golden Mile and the bar ( both inside and out ) is the place to be seen. The rooms are clean , modern and spacious....there is nothing the staff wont do for you..and yes... there are things that are costly... The free continental breakfast's are lovely and I understand if one is there for a week ,one would want a change . Let me warn you eggs benedict for 2 plus trimmings CA$ 100 ...The bar is a great place to start the eveing off...great atmosphere...same with the outside terrace ...but 2 drinks on the outside terrace...( ordinary beer and a glass of wine ) CA$ 25 ...The concierge is there to sort out all you needs from cabs to restaurants. I'm happy to answer any questions you may have. The Sofitel have done a good job here and it must surely be a worry to competitors. It really IS the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: cal2379
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for 6 nights on business and was very impressed by the experience. The service was polite and friendly and they tried to go the extra mile to help customers e.g. I went to the restaurant alone and they offered me a newspaper/ magazine - admitedly they forgot to bring it but it was the thought that counts! I ordered room service which arrived promtly. I spent some days working in my room and the maids were pleasant and thorough. The beds are extremely comfortable so I slept well. I had one experience where water was dripping through the bathroom ceiling from the room above. The maintenance person came promptly to solve the issue - it was obviously someone on the floor above filling their bath tub to overflowing which was sorted very quickly. The bathroom was very spacious with a separate bath tub and shower compartment. Breakfast was good although it was a little repetitive having the same continental breakfast every morning which was included in the room rate. Wifi was also included in the room rate which was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vik_101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Victoria Day weekend. The hotel is excellent.
