Location is very very good, on the same street as McGill University, 2 blocks from St. Catherine, and minutes from the high end stores. If you get a corner room you will love it, with sunshine filling up the room in the mornings. Some pointers: 1) The parking is over priced $30/day for valet they do not offer self park which I was very disappointed with. Just drive 1 block in either direction of the hotel and 24H parking is $10 in a covered lot - save your money for shopping! 2) Room service is very very expensive. $10 for a bagel! It is not even the famous Montreal Bagels. - if you need breakfast right away, walk 1 block to the Western hotel they have a bagel/coffee shop at the bottom. Not the best but will hold you over until you go out for some real food. 3) No Internet or WIFI service in fact they charge extra for this service. I have stayed at Sofitel's before and this is a first to have to pay for wifi. 4) get the staff in the lobby to make your reservations for restaurants, they seem to know how to get a table even if the restaurant is booked. 5) For those driving - Not sure if this applies when you decided to read this, but Sherbrooke Street was closed for construction so it was a pain to get to the hotel especially when you are not familiar with the area. 6) No Umbrellas in the rooms for those rainy days, but you can always get one from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good - perfect for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: travellingunderpants
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, a short walk to many restaurants / shopping. I typically book visiting colleagues at this hotel as it is impressive, has good service and a decent restaurant which is decent for a quiet meeting. Stayed here myself a few times, would go back and will continue to book visitors here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AddAdrTA
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel and great staff and concierge. Had a nice and large room. Would not recommend the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: LauraP186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel in Montreal in June 2010. The communual areas of the hotel were quite nice and luxurious, unfortunately the room was not up to the same standard as the communual areas. The room was very basic (to the standard of a holiday inn) and this was disappointing given the price we paid and given that Sofitel describes itself as a 5* luxury hotel. When I complained (after we got back) I was told that if I wanted a luxurious room I could have paid for an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: NJHamilton
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time despite very rainy, cold weather. The staff at the Sofitel is very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. The location is great - close to museums, many restaurants and metro stations. The director of Guest Relations, Vida, was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy beds in a handy location close to everything”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here recovering and relaxing after the madness of a week London. The hotel is fairly new and we were given was comfortably roomy with a very comfortable bed with fantastic linen. The location of the hotel is perfect - just a short stroll of a couple of blocks to the underground shopping malls. This was our second trip to Montreal and will definitely be returning to this hotel when we next return. Service from all staff at all times was friendly and attentive. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms”
Reviews.Author: funandrelaxation
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. This was our first time in Montreal and we were pleased with our decision to stay at the Sofitel. We had a one bedroom suite that was well designed and spacious. We loved the bathroom ... It was huge with a wonderful walkin shower. The toiletries were aplenty. The furniture in the living area could use an upgrade as it was not comfortable at all. However the bed was very comfortable and we slept really well. The concierge was particularly helpful. The restaurant and bar was delightful. The Hotel is close to the Museum of Fine Arts and shopping. A quick walk to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: chshenrique
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, room, restaurant and guest service. Near subway and comercial places. Wonderful bedroom for a good sleep night. I recommend stay in Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Hoity Toity for What?”
Reviews.Author: mahalia1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at the Sofitel to try something new seeing as when in Montreal we typically stay at the Novotel and it's from the same Accor chain but a bit higher end. The hotel was very easy to find driving and we opted for valet parking rather than self. The lobby is grand and the decor is lovely. The loung is very nice and bright with many windows. Upon check-in the Front Desk agent wasn't overly welcoming nor offered an upsell, asked what we were here for anything at all. I mentioned that there uniforms were very nice and she went on about fashion designers, how expensive her glasses were, how she just bought a Louis Vuitton, how she has an expensive car, how she has a Cartier watch, etc (we really didn't care and didn't go there to hear about her universe). We asked about things to see and do in the area that were going on and she said she said that we'd need to see the concierge. She got the check-in done but didn't offer anything else. The room was well decorated, clean and had great bathroom amenities and although it wasn't large, the furnishings were really well thought out to give room in the room. The little doors opening to the bathroom were lovely, I felt as though I was in France. The bathroom was lovely with a multiple head rainshower and the mirror was huge and the bathroom had great lighting. I don't like tubs in a hotel room seeing as I am germaphobic so, the luxurious shower was fabulous. There ws also an entire wall of windows overlooking Montreal city from floor to ceiling which was lovely i the evening with the view. We went to the lounge to have a drink and sat for 20 minutes and no one came to assist us so, we left. Upon leaving we mentioned that there was no one in the lounge to assist us and the same person whom checked us in said nothing. We went to the concierge desk to ask for recommendations and I seemed to know more than the concierge as to places to eat and things to see and do. For paying $389.00 for this hotel room, not even a suite we were disappointed. The location of the hotel was great but for paying the rate we did and for Sofitel to be an acclaimed luxury hotel we expected more service culture. The room itself was lovely. I can't comment on the food seeing as we never had the oppertunity to eat or drink there and there was no pool on property. I would recommend this hotel due to it's beauty but would only stay there again if the rate was better seeing as they didn't really offer anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DollyBird04
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last Summer and it's in a great location in order to get around the City on foot or via the Metro. The Visitor Information Centre is 5 minutes walk away (where you can book sightseeing tours etc) and Peel Metro Station is just around the corner from the hotel. Museums and Montreal's best shops are all close by. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and very comfortable and the staff are all extremely friendly and helpful. The room I had was a reasonable size and was a corner room with a view of the mountain and Sherbrooke Avenue. I also loved the L'Occtaine products that they give you each day in your bathroom - the nicest hotel toiletries ever. In a nutshell - a lovely hotel in a great location. I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing; stay here, and you will return....”
Reviews.Author: watwoman
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference, and we booked into The Sofitel; after having had a very bad experience with a hotel down the street, we were worried....there was no reason for concern, everything was fabulous!! Previously, we stayed at The Sofitel In Chicago - exceptional quality at both! In winter, it is great to have a hotel with a sauna - I was there everyday! There was also a nicely equipped exercise room, complete with TV, and cold water - sure wish I had remembered my running shoes! The king size beds were super comfortable; they have an in-room spa, so whatever service you choose is done in the privacy of your own room. I had a fabulous facial!! In room mini-bar, nicely lit closet, and quality L'Occitane beauty products are provided.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic hotel I've stayed at in Montreal is the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: FLJOntario
Reviews.Content: The most romantic hotel I've stayed at in Montreal is the Sofitel, located at 1155 Sherbrooke West at Stanley. We never rent a car, and prefer walking or taking a cab to get around, so location is paramount (it's also a short taxi ride to the train station). This hotel is centrally located, and near to great restaurants, shops and the McGill University campus. But we love the hotel -- and have returned to it several times -- because of the clean modern design, luxurious feeling and attentive service. Having stayed in ultra hip, expensive "shoeboxes" in New York City, I appreciate that even the smallest rooms are well laid out, bright and airy. They've got the details down to an art. The rooms are elegant in a fairly modern architectural style (but they should update their art -- the faux Van Gogh flowers on the wall above the bed was not up to the hotel's design "look".) If you're looking for a romantic, no hiccups experience, you don't want your beloved to be annoyed about the little details. The lighting for doing makeup is good. They have cozy robes. Hairdryers. Closets with ample room to hang short and full-length clothes. A safe to store your passport, etc. You would think all of those little "comfort" details would be taken care of at all hotels, but not so. The one criticism we have of the Sofitel is that their restaurant and room service are very pricey. We always go out to other restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: wombatus_10
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel. I now know the difference between a 4 star and 5 star. Rooms are modern, spacious, and quiet. L'Occitane products are given generously. Maid service was very good and everything was very clean and well presented. Location is excellent as shopping, restaurants, museums all within walking distance. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and very dog-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Achille_LeTeckel
Reviews.Content: I am a small dog (Miniature Dachschund) and I stayed at the Sofitel for three days with my family. I have to say I received the most warm welcome I had in a hotel so far... I was offered goodies and special attention when we checked-in. I stayed very quietly in the room during the day and the staff did not bother me! The location of the hotel is perfect and allowed me to walk around. Even though there was a complete mix-up when we checked-out (the bellboy wrote the wrong room number and we waited 1/2 hour our luggage at a peak time in the morning), I will remember positively of this place. The room-service is also fantastic (tasted by my Mum of course!): "a gastronomic level rarely reached in North America", she said. Plus, big detail: we did not pay any extra-fee for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge Team! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ihearttravel247
Reviews.Content: Road trip with friend to Montreal for 4-nights and picked Sofitel Hotel because of its location and our first encounter with the Concierge. Before even booking our room, the Concierge assisted us with touring information without hesitation. This is why we picked this hotel. Concierges Simon and Virginia (I hope I remembered their names) were fabulous before and during our stay. The hotel is conveniently located near Rue Catherine shopping street and Beaux Art museum. The fitness room is top notch and we put it to good use each morning. Stunning bathrooms with great soaking tub. The bar has a great ambience for drinks. Did not get a chance to dine in their restaurant. We definitely recommend the great staff of this hotel. Most accommodating in english and french! Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars if there was free internet... come on... 15$ !?!?”
Reviews.Author: RalR
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Wonderful, huge rooms, comfortable beds, great fitness room, wonderful location and a nice (pricey) bar... Would have been perfect if it wasnt for the exorbitant price of 24 hrs of wi-fi (15$ !!!). I travel quite often and am "spoiled" to expect free wi-fi. If it was 5$ I'd say well ok, maybe its just so people dont d/l movies or something, but 15$ is obviously milking the business traveler, which is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: CanucksAbroad62
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 days. Efficient staff and check in/out was a breeze. Very spacious double room with a large gorgeous bath, separate tub and rainfall shower but you do pay for it.. Good internet speed but not free. Great location easy walk to St Catherine's and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Radtrav
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many Sofitels world-wide and have been mostly pleased. This location is as good or better than all. No problems at all with any aspect of our stay. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizen50
Reviews.Content: We did indeed have a wonderful stay. The breakfasts were delicious, beautifully and imaginatively presented, and the service excellent. Really, the Reception Staff, the Concierge, the waiting staff in the restaurant, the housekeepers, all discreet but friendly, helpful and charming. The beds were so comfortable and we appreciated the service of linens being turned down in the evening. The housekeeper replaced the water bottles for us and there was always lots of L'Occitane bathroom supplies. It all made for a fantastic stay for us, and great memories of Montreal. Our son started at McGill University and this was our first visit, we will return for sure !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: 09Raleigh
Reviews.Content: Located centrally on what might be called the Park Ave (NYC) of Montreal. Modern adaptation of glass office building. First rate room and bathroom. Quiet room. By far the most helpful concierges I've encountered anywhere. Reasonable rates especially for groups. Near Mus of Fine Arts. Outstanding facility. Avoid restaurant for breakfast--inferior preparation at high prices. Seek out Au Pain Dore or Premiere Moisson for breakfast and pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs?”
Reviews.Author: DaveD005
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is the hotel is alright, the staff is a little rude and wow Bed Bugs?

Reviews.Title: “In general a nice hotel, no major...”
Reviews.Author: AI_Director
Reviews.Content: In general a nice hotel, no major complaints. Pluses: Really excellent bed. Location is great. Minuses: Slightly overpriced. Staff could be friendlier. No coffee maker in room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Concierge Team in Town”
Reviews.Author: indytravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with Sofitel globally for many years and am always astounded by the the professionalism and warmth provided by the entire team and especially the Montreal Sofitel concierge group. (So good in fact that I have asked them to set things up for me in other cites when I have no contacts there!) They are nothing short of brilliant and I would stay no where else when in Montreal. They greet our family as if we were old friends (which I think we have become) yet still manage an incredibly warm and professional relationship. No one should miss a chance to stay here. I stay in beautiful hotels around the world, and comparitively rarely, write any review, but this hotel deserves to be rated highly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Convexity1
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I went to the NASCAR and Grand-Am race the weekend of 8/26/10. The hotel immediately grabs you with a first-rate, European-looking lobby with interesting art. The staff is very friendly and bi-lingual (French and English). The room was clean, modern and with an outstanding bathroom with a glass enclosed marble shower and floor. The location is terrific with plenty of restaurants within walking distance but with the hustle and bustle of Saint Catherine street two blocks away. The neighborhood is very safe, as well. The service is very good while not being stuffy or uncomfortably formal. We walked in hot and tired from the races everyday and got a warm greeting from the doorman even though our appearance wasn't the greatest. I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well designed but watch charges”
Reviews.Author: FussySpender
Reviews.Content: Excellent king bed room, well designed bath, but check charges when leaving. Did not consume anything from room bar fridge but did store leftover sandwich for few hours. Not sure if this related, but after husband checked us out and we were on our way, I discovered two room bar fridge charges which definitely were not incurred by either one of us. Nonetheless, very helpful, friendly staff. Great location. Good linens. Great shower. Umbrellas and books in lobby. Recommend with above caveat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location, but better service needed on Checkout”
Reviews.Author: BabyandBunny
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a brief stay and couldn't find a dog sitter so we brought him along. I alerted the Concierge in advance about his oversize cage and he helpfully upgraded our room to accommodate it. Superior Rooms are a euphemism for Standard Rooms in this chain's hotelspeak and we simply couldn't have fit ourselves and a cage for a 120 pound pet. The hotel is attractively decorated with a clean, modern design. The Reception presented our only challenge and that occurred on checkout. The young lady wasn't familiar with the Expedia rates we had booked, which included a Superior Room, parking and a movie. On checking she learned of her oversight, but this needless arguing over rates was confrontational and did not need to occur.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location, puny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mjaeger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofitel Montreal for two nights at the end of July, she for business, but I to tag along and enjoy the sites and sounds of Canada's greatest city. Sorry Toronto! While I would definitely recommend this hotel, and it meets Sofitel standards, the room size was definitely inadequate. Indeed, our room - which was a deluxe suite - was no bigger than a regular room at the Best Western, and perhaps even smaller. And the regular rooms at the Sofitel - which I have read other complaints about on TripAdvisor - were probably closet sized! Granted, everything about the room was nice, and clean, with an awesome bed/mattress, I just thought that the room was kind of puny for a hotel of this calibre, and for the deluxe "label". Perhaps that is typical of major centres, not sure - I hear the rooms in London or Paris are even tinier. So may be I just need to get out more? Luckily we obtained an extremely good rate - $375 with taxes - for 2 nights from the Travelzoo website so I guess we can't complain too much, or may be not at all. But there was no free internet access. And while I suppose if you can afford to stay at a Sofitel paying for the internet should not be a problem, I thought that $15 per day was excessive, so I simply passed on it. $15 per day per room seems like a rip-off to me. Other than that, and on the plus side, the concierge service was second to none, and extremely helpful - in both official languages. So overall, I would still recommend the hotel - the location is very good for accessing most of the sites of Montreal, and literally a block or two away from the (must-see and free) Museum of Fine Arts. It is also relatively close to the Peel subway station from which you can access most of the City (on a world class subway system - Toronto are you listening?!?), and it's only about a 20 minute drive from the airport, perhaps 40 minutes during rush hour! If you want a nicer (and potentially more $$) alternative though, I would suggest the W Hotel in Montreal , which I stayed at 2 years ago. Absolutely top notch it was - in every respect - including room size, with a bathroom larger than some hotel rooms apparently....

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: dianai10
Reviews.Content: 3 of us booked one room with 2 beds. when we got there, they told me i had asked for 1 king bed and that's all they had. How could 3 people stay in one bed??? they told me that the hotel was sold out and they had no other options available. not even a room with a couch!! they ended up wheeling a COT into the room and sent us up a few cookies with an appology note. cookies and a cot in a 5 star hotel...are you kidding me??? they asked me if i had a confirmation email proving i booked that type of room, all i had was a confirmation number, they didn't ask me for my email address. what does it matter?? if the hotel is sold out it's sold out right? they said that if i was able to produce written proof then they would give me someone else's room. WORST experience i've had in Any hotel. The only nice thing about the room was the size of the bathrooms. Thats it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not best value”
Reviews.Author: TXwonderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel for 4 nights. We got to the hotel by taking STM 747 Express Bus from the airport. We bought the $7 pass at the airport exchange booth. The trip took about 30 mintues. Sofitel is 10 minutes walk from the bus stop. The hotel room and bath room are clean but quite small. There was not enough closet space for our two carry-on luggages. The room decor is centemperary with an IKEA kind of feel. The bed is comfortable and the room is quiet. I would rank the hotel at the same level as Hilton or Marriott. The business center is in a corner on the first floor with 3 PCs. The internet connection in room costs $15 per day. The hotel is close to Peel Metro station and St. Catherine shopping area. It is close to the Museum of Fine Art. There are a lot more restuarant on Rue Cresent. We bought the $17 3-day Metro pass to get around. You need to take metro to get to the old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: HILLAWY
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel during our honeymoon trip .. it was the best hotel i have ever been too ,,, clean , quite, great location , great service and very nice people .. its not expensive at all for what they offer .. I definitly recommend it to everbody !!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOLA77
Reviews.Content: Great location. Quiet. Fast check in. Restaurant onsite nice but very pricey. Good bar for cocktails with view of Sherbrooke St. Comfortable hotel but service did not wow me. No turndown service. Overall good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, great location, expensive drinks.”
Reviews.Author: NB1000
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a great location...we walked everywhere! The room was really nice, gorgeous bathroom, nice conceirge service. There is a really nice outdoor patio for drinks etc but I have to say I thought that $18 for one glass of wine or drink was REALLY over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Very artistic hotel - excellent concierge services”
Reviews.Author: cheshiremackat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and artistic. Beds were very comfortable and amenities plentiful. The downside to this hotel is location. It is still downtown Montreal, but a good 15min walk from "old montreal". The hotel is located closer to the 'mountain' and McGill university in a trendy area of Montreal. The location is nice/safe/trendy/fashionable - but a little further than some of the other hotels to "old montreal". The upsides to this hotel are in the services. You can arrange (for a fee) to have the bed made up with satin sheets. The hotel also offered an excellent restaurant and room service. You can also book spa services to your room. Overall, the staff seemed eager to go above and beyond for their customers. Valet parking was $30 per day, but service was prompt and courteous. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, not a 5-star, beware of Expedia pricing.”
Reviews.Author: Parod
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews about the smallest rooms being tinier than a cupboard I booked Superior rooms for me and colleagues through Expedia. I found out on check-in that their so-called "Superior" rooms were in fact their smallest standard rooms, which are pretty much 200 square feet and smaller than than your average Tokyo hotel room. A king size bed barely fits in the room. They seem to have a little scam going on where they suggest upgrading for a nightly fee to a "much better" room for people who booked through external websites. Now everyone in my company is complaning about the size of their rooms and not wanting to expense the upgrade as we are cutting back on travel costs. I would say avoid this hotel for business purposes unless you are absolutely guaranteed not to be in their smallest rooms. Their breakfast is also very bland for $34, I would recommend Cora or Eggspectation which are both walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay , but stop the email”
Reviews.Author: See_the_World_too
Reviews.Content: Liked : glass and steel exterior, classy location, super IKEA decor, professional staff, cleanliness, and cool patio with excellent but pricey menu. Disliked : lack of balcony or windows that open, no bathroom fan, tiniest bath tub ever seen in a hotel and ... multiple needy guest service emails demanding completion of satisfaction surveys !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_183
Reviews.Content: Great location. The room was clean and spacious. The bath tub was very small for a deluxe room. The staff was nice. I loved the L'Occitane products. Too bad there was no swimming pool. The food was okay and pricey. Overall, I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “half a room”
Reviews.Author: grandmaToronto
Reviews.Content: A few rooms on floor 16 have square rooms, that is 13 x 13 feet square. The room was fine for one person but not two. We had only small suitcases but nowhere to put them other against wall behind chair at desk and one in closet. One side of bed was well worn in hinting that one person usually lives in that room. After asking we were told that the rate we paid was for that room. Admittedly, we did get a very good deal, $150 incl. taxes per night. But the website suggests 330sq ft. rooms or larger. The hotel is nice though, and the concierge helpful. We ate breakfast at la belle provence, a chain downhill from the left of the hotel which has fruit and big fry up for $5. In old city the Savinage had a true french canadian feel. Probably mobbed when the cruise ships are in. Archealogical museum in old town worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but prices used to be better!”
Reviews.Author: TravelShopGirlVT
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel for its location and great rooms. Very comfortable pillow top beds, and great rain showers. Valet parking is quick and easy, but not included in price of room. Front desk staff friendly, nothing special. There is a restaurant on site, but with so many places to go on Montreal we have never tried it. This was our second stay, and the prices were a little higher than usual. Still overall a good value for a Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Ambience in a hip city!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: After taking a train from Quebec City, i arrived in Montreal for a 2 night stay, Made my way to the hotel via taxi not realising it is only about 5 blocks from the Train Station! In other words you could walk it! Once i got to the hotel being a Saturday afternoon the lobby was filled with a wedding party and the staff seemed very eager to get non wedding guests (IE other Sofitel guests) out of the lobby. After checking me in i was issued a room from memory on the 14th floor, It was beautiful, Marble Bathroom with a generous serving of L'Occitane products including a bath and seperate shower, A big plasma screen tv, The most COMFORTABLE bed, and it was very spacious. I was more than happy with it, The location is great, About a 4 block walk to St Catherine where the main shopping part is and you are also near an Eaton Centre which has a great food court if youre looking for an inexpensive way to eat! I took a Gray Line tour and they pick you up outside the front door, Old Montreal is a short subway/train ride away and Sherbrooke subway station is only about a block, The concierge was very friendly and she was very helpful for giving directions! My only dissapointment....No Swimming Pool, But they had a great business centre with free internet (Located off the lobby), and a fitness centre although i didnt get time to use it! I have to admit Sofitel is probably my preferred hotel for a luxury escape and if im ever back in Montreal i would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Montreal - great expectations, not all that great though.”
Reviews.Author: ChristyChase
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel in Montreal for a week to visit friends and family during the holidays in December 2009. Thrilled with my prior experiences at the luxurious Sofitel in Chicago, I expected the same gold standard up North...but was quite dissappointed with our stay. First of all, the standard room only had a shower - no bathtub. This wasn't an issue until my boyfriend and I came down with a nasty flu and requested a room with a bathtub, only to find out that we had to "upgrade" to the next class of room if we desired one for an extra $50+tx per night. Most luxury hotels in North America offer both a shower AND a bath in their standard luxury rooms. Second of all, we had prepaid the entire weekly hotel stay yet we noticed that a $200 charge from the Sofitel was appearing on our debit card every day or so!?! When we inquired what the debits were about, we were told that it was a customary hold just in case we had incidentals, and that our funds would be replaced within 7 days upon checkout. What the...?!? Typically, a certain amount is blocked in case of incidentals on a credit card...but a charge of over $200/day on a debit card was unusually steep. Furthermore...the fire alarm went off one morning at 9AM and the hotel directions were vague and discombobulated. First the increasingly blaring alarm nonstop, then we were informed they were trying to locate the cause of the alarm, then we were advised to stay in our rooms...very confusing directions and we ended up walking down 17 flights of stairs (!?!) just in case there really was a fire on the premises. Last but not least, I tried to communicate with the room service maid to let her know we were checking out at 1pm, but the poor thing spoke neither French nor English. Um, ok. Sign language, anyone?? In a nutshell...Montreal has plenty of beautiful luxury hotels with spectacular service, but this one was less-than-average at best. Try the hotels in hip Old Montreal instead!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ISA51
Reviews.Content: The online reviews of this hotel (other websites) mention some features I did not find - like a rain shower and so on but overall the rooms were very clean, good decorations, the hotel is centrally located. I would only say to head elsewhere for breakfast because the hotel's restaurant was extremely pricey and the coffee was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sofitel great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Windycity21
Reviews.Content: I took a trip with a few friends for a Labor Day weekend to Montreal. After research on Trip Advisor and finding an awesome deal on Travelocity. We got 1 night free. I booked the Sofitel. Be aware when booking on Travelocity or any other sites, most bargain prices are NON-REFUNDABLE when booked, even when you have to cancel. We got our room for about 160 a night. It was the luxury room, which is a bit bigger than the other rooms. Good Points about hotel 1. Modern, very clean. 2. Polite front desk and door men 3. Spacious bathroom with products 4. Close to Mont-Royal Park and Rue St.Catherine shopping and public transit 5. If you need a cab, the door men can get you one really fast. 6. Free use of computer terminals in the hotel lobby. There 3 computers with a printer. Great to use to check email, print maps etc. Cons about hotel 1. Restaurant is overpriced. There is a great breakfast place, 2 blocks from the hotel called Eggspectations. It open at 6:00/6:30 in the morning. 2. It is just far enough from Old Montreal that you need to take a cab or bus. You can walk 2-3 blocks to the Tourist Information center and pick up bus 515 to Old Montreal. Much cheaper than the cab. Very convinent. 3. Nearest grocery store for soda and snacks is about a 6- 7 block walk. I would definitely stay here again. Hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel rip-off”
Reviews.Author: marctor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travelocity.ca and had to cancel my trip for personal reasons. Throughout the whole cancellation process, there was no indication that I would lose the whole amount paid (over C$300). As I was expecting to have a refund I contacted travelocity - they said it was the hotel's responsibility. I called Sofitel, and they said that yes, as I had booked through travelocity they would keep the whole amount even though they would never provide any service. So, basically, what they are saying is if you book through Travelocity and you have to cancel your reservation it's your problem. I would say 1. avoid travelocity and 2. avoid Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TeachNewEngland
Reviews.Content: After searching through reviews here on Trip Advisor, we found the Sofitel. When all the reviews said COMFY bed, I said this is the place and booked it. Every one of those reviews was right!! You will not want to get out of bed in the morning!!! The days we did get out of bed we walked down to St. Catherine St where there was plenty of shopping and eating to be had. The location was perfect to tour the city on foot. I will DEFINITELY be staying at the Sofitel on my next visit to Montreal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Frosty306
Reviews.Content: It's European modern in style but is not stuffy or uncomfortable. The rooms are absolutely beautiful! Beds are so soft you don't want to climb out of it in the morning. And they have the amazing rain shower shower heads and glass shower stalls that we now see becoming very trendy. Absolutely 5-star without being snobby!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: gottagoseek
Reviews.Content: Great luxury hotel in the center of Montreal. Easy to get around using the metro or taxis. Bed was super comfortable and the sheets were so soft. We needed a good break and this was a relaxing place to come home to. Nice toiletries, excellent shower. Really everything you would expect from a hotel of this class. Computers in the lobby to use for internet and a printer too. This was quite useful. It would be nice, for the price, to have free internet throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: UKKiwiHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights. The room was lovely - we got an upgrade - a good size & very clean. The only thing missing was tea & coffee making equipment but it doesn't seem as common in rooms outside Asia/Pacific. Service was excellent in most cases but we were disappointed by staff in the bar. We were twice told at just after midnight that the bar was closing & one night we went in at 12.10am to see 3 staff standing around & were told the bar was closed, there was one down the street we could go to! Not good enough for a 5 star hotel. The concierge was extremely good, knew the answer to everything we asked. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Sofitel...luxury and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: queenices
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Montreal over Labor Day Weekend. It is on the "Golden Mile" , catty corner to the Omni Mont-Royal, which is one of my preferred hotels. However, given the similar price that the dated (but currently under renovation) Omni wanted for the same stay, I chose the newer and more modern Sofitel. I loved this hotel-- it is voguish, sleek, and smart, with superb staff and amenities. The lobby is large, light, airy and chic. I went up to my room, where I got a personalized welcome as an A-Club member. The room is average-sized, and some may consider it on the small side, (especially given the price), however the use of space is very efficient and functional. The decor is trendy and the room's lay-out, particularly the the foyer entrance to the room -- equipped with a shelf with a candle set to enhance ambiance, gave the place an almost homey feeling. Light seems to be a theme with the hotel, and the use of natural light has been incorporated into the hotels decor and atmosphere. The expansive windows in the rooms are ceiling to floor. I had a corner room, and so I got plenty of sunshine. The marble bathroom is luxurious, from the Occitaine toiletries to the fixtures, especially with the rain shower head, and the two-way shower door. My bathroom did not have a bathtub. I didn't want to get out of that plush bathrobe and slippers that were provided. The room and the entire hotel are impeccably spotless. I don't know if I can say anything more about the bed that hasn't already been stated. The bed is dressed with feather comforters, pillows, and mattress top. It's like sleeping on a cloud -- deep and peaceful. Do not get into this bed at the end of a long day unless you plan to stay there for the evening, and good luck getting out of it in the morning. It's *that* comfortable. The hotel staff is exceptionally professional, attentive, and as another reviewer stated, quite unobtrusive. They all speak English well, without a snobbish attitude. Housekeeping comes and goes quietly, the front desk checks you in and out in a snap and, the concierge tends to everyone smartly and intuitively. The bartenders and valet were superb. Speaking of the valet parking, I used the valet parking $30CAD/day (in and out) while I was there. Normally, my car would be ready within 10 minutes, however, this particular weekend there were several weddings and other affairs being held at the hotel. So at times the valet service could take up to 20-30 minutes during events, and the vehicle reception area would be crowded and congested with vehicles and taxis loading/unloading passengers. The valet/concierge services were very apologetic and did their best to deliver the vehicles as quickly as they could. The bar/restaurant service during this time was also stretched as the staff augmented event service, but they always managed to give you the attention you deserve. However, the Renoir restaurant and bar was fantastic. They served remarkable dishes and drinks, and it is a popular spot with hotel clientele and locals alike. Not surprisingly, the food and particularly the drinks, are quite expensive. There are many fine and lesser expensive choices near to the hotel, and throughout Montreal, but if you do have supper at the hotel, you would enjoy it. The location is great -- near a Metro stop, the great shopping of Ste. Catherine, and the nightlife of St. Denis and St. Laurent, as well as the Museum of Fine Arts and McGill University. My only complaint is that for the price of the room, they should offer free wireless Internet in the rooms. There are computers (3 of them) in the lobby available to use at no cost. I found them to work very well and I didn't have to wait to use one. I exceedingly enjoyed the hotel and would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Excellent Value !”
Reviews.Author: JayNewY0rk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with the "stay 3 nights pay 2 nights" promotion that Sofitel is running, what a deal! A beautiful hotel, nice room, big floor-to-ceiling windows, great bathroom and very comfortable bed. The entire staff was very helpful and pleasent. The location is great, between the Fine Arts Museum and McGill College Avenue. We walked every where from there. I can not wait to return for another weekend !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dublingirlabouttown
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was excellent. The location was good for us, near the shops and the hip restaurants of St Denis. However, it might be a bit far from the restaurants of the old town if you are not up for the 20 minute walk. The room was great and the bed divine. L'Occtaine toiletries - a real treat. We did not eat in the hotel as there was way too many tempting options on the doorstep. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dcomdus
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, fantastic room, fantastic bed, fantastic breakfast

Reviews.Title: “The most luxurious bed I've ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: kfn
Reviews.Content: Missed our connecting flight In Montreal (from Quebec to LAX) last week so we were forced to spend the night in Montreal. When a fellow stranded local traveler suggested The Sofitel we hesitated at first ($$$$) but when we arrived and fell onto the bed, we were so glad we decided to splurge! What a wonderfully comfy, cozy bed! The bedding just wrapped itself around you. I'm a light sleeper and wake often during the night; I did not budge! Too bad we only had 5 hours to enjoy that bed due to an early flight. Also, the downtown street was noisy all night and we were up on the 12th Floor. Room service was excellent (mushroom, asparagus risotto) but pricey. All in all, it was a night to remember.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: abc037
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay at this hotel and I can't find anything negative to tell. Rooms were spacoius and the rainforest shower a dream. Staff was friendly and it was everything you would expect from a sofitel and 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection with unobtrusive service”
Reviews.Author: fee57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel 15th to 20th August for a wedding. What an excellent hotel. Rooms - They were well appointed. Very comfortable beds, the room and bathroom were very large. The usual amenities like flat screen TVs, separate shower and bath. The only disappointment was that there were not double basins in the bathroom. Service - Excellent throughout and unlike most 5 star hotel the staff was not obstrusive. They were there to assist you if you needed it. Food - The best hotel food I have ever had. The breakfast is to die for try their signature egg white scrambled with spinach, mushroom and tomatoes. The only hotel that came close in terms of breakfast is the W in Seattle. The pastry is as they make it in France...that says it all. When I am next in Montreal the choice will be obvious.

Reviews.Title: “Started out SO good...”
Reviews.Author: cutiegirlWhitby
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Thursday and were very impressed with the service and treatment from the staff. Our room was 318, which is above the banquet hall where weddings and other things are held. The rooms are beautiful and we loved the bath robe and slippers! The beds were absolutely incredible and we didn't want to leave simply for that reason alone. Shopping of course was great and so was the food. We never did eat at the hotel, however walked to Old Montreal most evenings. Its about a 25 minute walk. We also walked up Mont Royal, which was also about 25 minutes on a straight upward incline! The only thing to mark our trip was on Saturday night. A wedding was being held and unfortunately it sounded like we were over a night club. We were able to hear the words to the songs and pick out what was being played. The bass was so loud that the mirrors were rattling on the walls. But being fairly young ourselves and not planning to go to bed too early, we didn't worry at first. At 11:30 I called reception and she stated that it should be over in an hour or hour and a half. We just put up with it figuring at 1 a.m. it would be over....it wasn't. At about 1:30 I went down to reception in my pajamas with my mouthguard still in. I was asked to sit in the lobby and wait for the Customer Service Manager, which I did wait - for about 5 to 10 minutes. He was polite and said I should have come down sooner and that the music would continue until about 2 a.m. He offered us another suite on the 9th floor. So sometime after 2 a.m. we were in that, however I was so mad that no compensation had been even offered - I couldn't sleep. I had so been looking forward to one last amazing sleep in that amazing bed! The manager had stated that we were welcome to use the bigger suite the next morning and take a late checkout. That wouldn't help us since we had a big drive ahead and planned an early checkout. We were also told that any room service we ordered would be put on the tab for our original room. That was a bit of a slight as well. I wasn't too impressed with him. I don't have is card on me anymore to remember his name. It didn't go over well though when a few hours later we had our alarm go off and had to hop on the elevator all bedraggled to ride back down to the third floor to get showered and packed. Of course someone got on the same elevator as us. How embarassing. We must have looked like something that had been run over a few times. Anyhow, saving grace was that morning upon checkout with big bags under our eyes, there was a different person on the front desk. He originally checked us in and was FANTASTIC to deal with. He sincerely apologized and said we could expect to be contacted about the situation. So that has made me feel better. We hope we will get our moment of recompense. Today is our first day home and we have yet to receive that phone call......I sure hope it comes because we would still love to go back to that hotel. The amenities and service from the staff (other then that one rep on Saturday night) were wonderful. Its a great place to stay. I guess my only recommendation would be - don't stay on the third floor!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Comfort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkent924
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Hotel in Montreal, conveniently located two blocks from McGill University, is a luxurious, comfortable hotel with excellent service. Expect to pay a premium for your stay, as this is one of the priciest hotels in Montreal. The rooms are large and very comfortable with trademark beds that lure you to sleep. The lobby is first class, with a very good but expensive restaurant (better eating values are found within a short walk). concierge and staff are extremely courteous and helpful, and take pride in assisting guests with directions, reservations, and advice on sightseeing. Spa and massage service is also available. A short three block walk from the Hotel puts you at the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts, and the Hotel is close to the Metro lines. I would recommend this Hotel for business travelers and those leisure travelers not on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “book it !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulRudd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We checked in on the 1st Aug and at the moment are still here. We love it. The rooms are modern, clean and well thought out. We are in a corner room with two windows. The beds are so comfortable you just sink into them and enter a deep sleep. The bathroom has a large shower with a rainhead shower and a wall shower. Wardrobe space is good and you get a safe. Each night they turn down the beds and leave free evian. As we are here a while we had a fridge put in the room and went out and bought a kettle, the hotel doesn`t offer tea of coffee making facilities in the room, shame. We had a rental car and used the valet service, it`s $30 per day with in and out, the valets are really quick to bring the car up and to be honest it`s not worth looking for a space and paying, on street parking is payable up to 9pm. Tonight we ate in the restaurant, serive was impeccable and the food worthy of five stars. I am so happy we are staying here, it really is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pjpnt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. In the center of it all. More than accomodating to our pet. The room was tiny, but Montreal is gorgeous in the summer, so we spent very little time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ascenseur
Reviews.Content: Having experienced wonderful stays at Sofitel locations in Chicago, London and Washington, DC, I decided to book the Montreal property for a recent leisure weekend. It is a decision I do not regret in the least bit. The Sofitel Montreal is supremely luxurious, stylish and comfortable. The location can't be beat in terms of access to shopping, attractions, dining and public transportation. I usually loathe having to deal with a car, but the valet staff made the experience seamless - my car was always available within 5 minutes. I was impressed with the housekeeping staff - they seemed to slip in and out of the rooms silently, never intruding. I never even saw them in 3 days! Speaking of quiet, this hotel is utterly silent. Our room, of the "Luxury" tier, was very large by urban hotel standards with a plush bed that was almost impossible to climb out of. The palatial marble bathroom felt kingly. Drinks in Le Bar were good, though $24 for 2 ounces of scotch did catch me by surprise. With so many options nearby, I cannot fully recommend it. I was also disappointed that there is no in-room wireless internet service. However, this is a fantastic hotel and lives up the standards of its much-lauded sister properties around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights with a friend. We lucked out and got a handicapped room, so it was very spacious and had a little foyer. Here are the positives: The service was very good. Check-in was smooth as well as check out. The concierge was very helpful and all the suggestions for restaurants were good. The Metro station was very close which made getting around Montreal very easy. The beds were so comfortable. The main negative was that the room's carpet was disgustingly stained and there was noise in the middle of the night coming from the room above us every night. But overall, it was a nice stay, but not sure that I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when you want to impress”
Reviews.Author: Ritzcee
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with excellent service. The rooms are very nice and the bathrooms are phenomenal. The staff is also very nice and accommodating. It's located in a pretty good place too. That being said, however, you could get something just as nice, or perhaps even nicer, for much cheaper. In my opinioin, this is a hotel that you choose when you wish to impress. It's not very practical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sofitel!!”
Reviews.Author: SkunkFunk29
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 times at the Sofitel Montreal ;at the end of May 2009 and again in June. The staff was very friendly and professional, the room , the nice lobby it was all perfect! Our room on the 16th. floor was spacious and had a great view! I love the Sofitel My Beds...we slept as a rose! Nice bathroom and I loved the strong waterpressure in the shower! The location was perfect as well! Sofitel is never cheap but if you like luxury and style this hotel is a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: MigratoryBillfish
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many parts of the world and I can honestly say that the staff at the Sofitel Montreal will treat you right. I was attending business and they made my stay quite enjoyable. The entire staff was helpful and kind. I stayed in a King Suite and the room was well appointed. Can not say enough about the bed......after a long day.......it was perfect. More importantly, the staff was superb and I always felt anything needed was a simply phone call away. I hardly think you would go wrong selecting The Sofitel Montreal. The location was superb along with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJaysFans
Reviews.Content: Our review echoes what WDavies wrote. We stayed in the hotel in July 2008, a lot can happen in a year but hereâ€™s some food for thought as you plan your summer trips. It. Was. Awful. We had horrible service and the room we got was not as advertised. We pre-paid for our superior room and when I asked for a room with a tub, we were told that for an extra $50/night, that we could switch. The kicker is that if I would have pre-booked that room I would have paid much less for the difference. Donâ€™t go by the pictures they have of the rooms on their website, rain shower and tub are NOT is every room. I was very disappointed and the staff were very rude about it. The â€œpiÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistanceâ€� was that we were walked in on, YES, you read that right. Thankfully we were decent, but not by much. I have never, ever been in a hotel when that has happened, they knocked, we said hello, they used there key and entered. After all that, there were incorrect charges on the room that was a hassle to fix, icing on the cake at check-out. I wanted to leave but we were there for the Just for Laughs festival and hotel rooms were scarce unless you had $$$$. If you prefer snobby, pretentious hotels, Sofitel just may be the place for you. My suggestion is to keep looking, if youâ€™re in the market for Sofitelâ€™s price point then there are better options in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: PeteCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2008 for a biomedical conference. The room was spacious with an entry area, two double beds, and lots of lamps, including reading lamps overhanging the beds. The bathroom was huge, with a cubicled rain shower and separate bathtub. Amenities were super. Lobby had computers for guest use, so no need to bring laptop just for e-mail. Location was superb, a short walk to St Catharine and the boutiques of Sherbrooke, and the Musee des Beaux Arts. The cuisine in the restaurant (Renoir?) was excellent, though pricey. The breakfast was worth the money. Will come back again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: nh1984
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, with nice, comfortable rooms and in a good location. That said, it is not good value for Montreal. I had booked a Deluxe room for $230 / night and, given the reviews on this site and the price, expected a luxury hotel. While it is perfectly pleasant, the Sofitel is not a luxury hotel. It is a rather blandly decorated 3/4-star, with tired-looking furniture and fluorescent lights. If you're paying for the room, save yourself some money and stay across the street at the Omni for half the price. It will be a bland hotel that is not particularly memorable. But then again the Sofitel isn't much better.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury!”
Reviews.Author: VivaLaPlaya!
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Sofitel Montreal. We enjoyed our stay and plan to return for our future trips to Montreal. Location Access very easy, great location downtown, you can walk your way in Montreal from there. Parking (not included and 30$ a day extra) Room Luxury! Great bed, confortable; huge windows; having a corner room, we had 2 windows and much light. You really feel "downtown in a big city", in the middle of the skyscrapers... Our room was a little bit small and the bathroom had only a shower, no bath, but for the price we paid (149$/night from Expedia, wich is cheaper than the official Sofitel website) we were very very satisfied of the value. Room service. Great breakfast, but expansive and incomplete. Front desk We felt we arrived downtown Paris! Many French employees; we've been asked if we were talking about "petit dÃ©jeuner" when we asked about the "dÃ©jeuner" (France vs Quebec french subtility...). But very professionnal and attentive service. The general look is very neat, and "urban", the lobby is impressive. We will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for a flying visit”
Reviews.Author: JDE260767
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one quick overnight. Arrived late and left after breakfast. Check-in and out were quick and helpful. Hotel very clean, modern and comfortable. Breakfast was VERY high quality but "a la carte" only (no buffet), so not the fastest. My room overlooked the street and consequently suffered from a lot of street noise. Overall, great place to stay but ask if there are any quiet rooms away from street noise!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel, great gym”
Reviews.Author: traveling2morrow
Reviews.Content: Room - On the small side but large enough for a business travler. I had the cheapest room at the hotel too. Lots of pillows, great bathrobs, slippers. Service - Friendly and accommodating staff. The mini bar has an autosensor and when I requested another mini fridge, they were prompt and brought me exactly what i wanted. Room service: Decent. Hotel has great healthy breakfast options, including ones for vegetarians! Downside, there dinner options are not as healthy as breakfast and not as vegetarian friendly. Gym - the best part of the trip. The gym has 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical, 1 bike, a set of dumbells, weight machines, bathrooms, sauna, heart monitors, towels, massage room, basu ball, balance ball, yoga mats. I got a great work out. Downside: they are remodeling the gym so it closed early. Location: Near Crescent and Saint Catherine. Close enough to the action in the summer. Would have preferred closed in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: WDavies
Reviews.Content: Have stayed regularly at the Sofitel in NYC so expected a similar quality hotel in Montreal. Was VERY disappointed - I stay about 60 nights a year in hotels but I walked out of a hotel for the first time in my life! Booked a "Superior Room" on Travelocity - assumed that meant that it was "superior" to something else so was one step up from the standard. Got to the hotel to check in to be met by a very snooty front desk girl who was VERY unhelpful. Asked for a room with 2 beds - not possible unless I was willing to pay $50/night extra. Then asked whether the room had a coffee maker or if we could get hold of a kettle - not possible unless you upgrade at $50/night extra. We travel with our own tea and cups so all we need is a way of heating water - they weren't willing to help out even with that. Got to the tiny room - you could touch all walls while holding onto the bed - to find that there was no tub - just a shower. It was -20 outside, we were cold and needed to thaw out in a hot bath. Called Reception - yes, a room with a both was available - but you guessed it, at a charge of $50/night! This was the straw that broke our back - their Superior rooms are tiny, have 1 bed and no bath - so what is "superior"? I called Travelocity who were able to cancel the room and find us a much better, more welcoming, place at the Meridien with front desk staff who were genuinely friendly and keen to welcome us and provide service to us. Never again, Sofitel..

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn99
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nghts in September 2008. The hotel is well located for sightseeing, shops and restaurants and close to public transport. The service was good and the breakfast absolutely excellent, though expensive. Our main criticism is that the room was very small and there was not enough storage for people like us on a two week holiday. Perhaps the hotel is aimed more at business travellers. In the lobby there are three computers with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference location”
Reviews.Author: David777
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this hotel on a business conference. Superb levels of service and food consistently high standard - breakfast, lunch and dinner - a welcome change to the normal inedible buffets served up at business venues. Great location close to some great local restaurants and shopping. Room very well fitted out and very comfortable. Excellent service. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable, Mostly Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: 2due
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Sofitel Golden Mile on the Montreal Sweet Deals package; second night at half price, breakfast for two included. The package has since changed to free parking rather than breakfast. With breakfast, the rate (averaged at C$150 per night) represented very good value. We arrived early and they were able to install us in a room within 15 minutes; they also upgraded us to a deluxe room. Very kind and efficient service. The bathroom had both a bath and shower; it was perfect, as was the bed. Housekeeping was impeccable. We needed a refrigerator (there is an automatic minibar in the room) and they brought one immediately. Weaknesses: - The room faced east-- there was a tower adjacent, so leaving the curtains open was unfortunately not possible. In the future, I would request a south or west facing room. - traffic noise could be heard on the 5th floor; the hotel was generally quiet but we could hear the ice machine at night; - windows do not open so no fresh air; - there was a cigarette burn in the bedding--a very small detail that did not bother us. Breakfast was served in the Renoir restaurant; on the first visit we were seated immediately next to the open kitchen but otherwise both service and food were excellent. On the second visit we reserved a table at the window; they claimed they did not have a reservation and, although there were many empty tables, they made a bit of a fuss. Both service and food on the second visit were lacking, unfortunately: breakfast was cold, coffee was not refilled, and servers were scarce. Overall, however, this was an excellent hotel experience and one that I would certainly repeat at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Montreal is Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Basil_Travels
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 4 nights at the Sofitel Montreal at 1155 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, and it was a delight. The room was on the 16th floor looking down on Rue Sherbrooke. The room with king size bed was modern, clean with floor to ceiling windows giving lots of natural light. The bathroom had a double shower stall (a real pleasure to shower in!!) and a very large vanity. The room rate of CAD$322 included breakfast in the Renoir Restaurant which was something else - eggs benedict with several variations to choose from. The hotel is near to several museums, restaurants and close to the Peel St metro. The staff were pleasant at all times and the complimentary internet/PCs (a must for all hotels who want to be taken seriously) in the Lobby area had the fastest connection. I recommend this hotel - you won't be disappointed. Jeff & Basil from Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: minnie_n
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and usually I never sleep well on hotel beds. The room and service were great. It had all of the amenities you'd expect from The Sofitel. The only downside to this trip was leaving my glasses in the room and being charged $50 to have them sent back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice room , Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cerveza_por_favor_8
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotel in Montreal, It's such a classy hotel, love the room , the services,They really do go out of their ways to please their guest, even if you donâ€™t make 100K annually.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mistralksk
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, modern bulding, good location in the moderm area of Montreal. Friendly and useful people in recepction. Rooms are good with everything you need. Free internet in the business center close to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: NJ_07645
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at Sofitel for a romantic weekend getaway. We were impressed with the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. However, the room we got was a let down. The size of the deluxe room was disappointing as it was much smaller than the regular room at the Omni. We had a lovely view of the adjacent high rise despite being on the penthouse floor. The extra money we had paid to stay at this hotel could have been better spent elsewhere (steak dinner at Queue de Cheval?). Don't get me wrong...it's a perfectly lovely hotel. But I've had better accomadations elsewhere for less.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spyderwoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for several nights because it was pet friendly and I had my dog with me. They were wonderful from the beginning. Very friendly and accomidating. I checked in very early and they immediately found me a room. The room is certainly not huge but very modern and great views. Although I did hear several doors closing early in the morning I did not hear any other noise all night. The employees were friendly and helpful. There is a nice gym and pleasant restaurant. My only complaint is no coffee maker in the room. Great location on Sherbrooke and close to shopping and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: jl#1
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in two rooms at the Sofitel Montreal for a week. We had a corner Superior King room. Our children had a Deluxe room with 2 double beds. Great location in an upscale residential and business area. Safe, clean and many cafes and dining options in walking distance. Each room had floor to ceiling windows. The corner room had windows on two sides. The A/C was effective and quiet in each room. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The Deluxe room is larger than the superior (which is a very good size), with much more storage space and a tub as well as shower in the bathroom. The storage space in the superior room was inadaqute for 2 people staying for a week, but we were creative, using every drawer and shelf, and it was OK. The Deluxe room came with a flat screen panel TV, while the superior room had an old fashioned tube TV. Glass enclosed showers, which doesn't work well for older children sharing a room. The shower in the superior room is very large, and comes with a rain shower as well as a hand held sprayer. The sink was a very attractive bowl design, but very little counter top space. Much more counter top space in the bathroom in the Deluxe room. Granite and marble and upscale fixtures throughout both bathrooms. Comfortable bathrobes. While many hotels boast of their bed linens, and some offer triple sheeting, this hotel only had a comforter and no top sheet. That was surprising. We asked for a top sheet for each of the beds, which was provided. The pillows were OK. The bath towels and toiletries were of very good quality. The beds were on the firm side, acceptable, but no competition to the Weston Heavenly Bed. Internet access is extra, at $16 per day. Since we only pay about $25 per month for high speed acess at home, we skipped the internet service in the room, and used one of the 3 free computers located in a business hospitality section of the lobby. The hotel might earn more if they charged $5 per day, which would undoubtedly get more customers for them. Parking is $30 per night. There are many garages in the area that charge much less. Valet service is prompt. Thanks to the person who wrote about the exchange rates offered by the Omni hotel about a block away. The Omni had much better rates (about 10% better) than the Sofitel. The entire staff is very accommodating and friendly. Trendy, modern and large lobby which is very interesting. The lack of storage space in our Superior room, lack of sheeting on the beds, and the beds just being OK are the main drawbacks. Couldn't decide if we should give 4 or 5 stars because of this. Decided to go with 4 stars because as a luxury hotel, these items should be addressed. Would nevertheless stay there again. Recommend Van Houtte Cafe at 400 de Maisonneuve O, just down on Stanley Street about a block away, for breakfast. Although the selection is limited to baked goods, fruit, juice, coffee and tea, the food is a great value, fresh, very clean place and great service

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: hmca
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by this hotel - the first Sofitel I've stayed in. We had two adjacent corner rooms with an outside door, which was perfect with two children as we could leave the bedroom doors open. Very clean, bright rooms and extremely comfortable beds. Didn't eat in the hotel or use room service so can't comment on that. Three PC's with free internet use in the hotel lobby, which was enough for our needs. Booked a special which gave the 4th night free plus a picnic - which came in a wicker hamper with plates, cutlery, glasses, really nice food and wine, but which was so heavy you certainly couldn't have taken it outside! Only real complaint was the lack of a kettle or coffee maker in the room. They were happy to provide a fridge, but not a kettle. And the beautiful bathrooms have no locks on the doors, which is a bit peculiar. But other than that, I would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicksaab
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October 2007. Check-in was prompt and friendly. The room was very nice and comfortable.The food in the restaurant (French cuisine) was excellent although expensive. The bar area was rather small with seating for about 20. During the weekday evening the bar gets rather crowded with local office workers up to about 8pm so this might not be the ideal place for a quiet drink. The hotel in centrally located. All hotel staff were pleasent and friendly. The service was very good. I would recommend this hotel for both business a leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expect from a 5 star Hotel, except for the breakfast and views”
Reviews.Author: aromes
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I expect from a 5 star Hotel (very clean, trendy, luxurious, great service, amazing staff, 5 stars amenities, great layout, comfortable trendy rooms,..etc), except for the breakfast and views from your rooms (breaksfasts are too pricey for what they are. They also lack for freshness since I found my benedict eggs to be cold and fruits not that fresh). I was leaving on 10th floor (room 1004) and am being told by some buddies who frequently stay there that that part has the best views I can get from the windows: well, I had couple of rental-buildings in front and a piece of Sherbrooke street on the side...not horrific, but not awesome neither. Overall, a hotel I would highly recommend. PS: I know there's big hype about their beds being comfortable. I tested it and actually the secret is not with the mattress itself, but with the bif layout of comforter they put on that matress. The bed is definitely comfortable eventhough I had not yet ran across a comfortable bed as the one I slept in at Fairmont Tremblant!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel... a few issues”
Reviews.Author: cor_1515
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at the Sofitel and had an overall pretty good experience. I did find it to be a little bit pretentious. I stayed in a Deluxe King which I booked on Expedia during a 24 hour sale. I don't know if I would pay the regular rate of $285/night. Parking is $30/day however we parked at the Renaissance (about a 3 min. walk) for $22. Also room service is EXTREMELY expensive... though I am assuming they are catering to individuals with expense accounts... I found the Concierge to be quite helpful.... though the front desk was a little bit aloof. The rooms were large and the beds were EXTREMELY comfortable! The location is very central and walking distance to downtown (St, Catherine, Cresent Street etc.) The most major annoyance was upon my return I realized they had charged my credit card an extra $200.00. I believe this was a deposit, though I was never informed of such. When I called the hotel I was told the monies would be released in 7 days, so we will see if it is.........

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: QWatson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for my 30th B-day and I was not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and modern and the customer service is beyond top notch!

Reviews.Title: “5* and a 5* price”
Reviews.Author: Skillet_87
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, excellent service, expensive. I didn't eat at the hotel, didn't buy the internet service, didn't spend one penny beyond the room, parking ($30) and taxes. I had a great stay. The location is convenient for driving to/from, subway, etc. A bit far from Old Montreal, but we walked it in 20 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “great location,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so well located near the high end stores, McGill and Mount Royal. It is modern, bright and very well run. We belong to Sofitel Privelege so were upgraded and given an early checkin and late checkout. The bar and restaurant are attractive but very modern. I booked the wrong dates online with no changes allowed but the hotel corrected my mistake at no charge. My only problem was that the windows don't open

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MellowYellow716
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for two nights while in Montreal on business. The room was very nice. The bed was a bit too soft for me but I'm sure it would be just right for most people. The mini bar and room service prices were very expensive but that's to be expected at any high-end hotel. Huge closet and bathroom were a definite plus. The front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent, just two blocks from the great shops on Sainte Catherine Street and a few blocks from the Eaton Centre mall. Overall I had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edward_R
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at a Sofitel property (the first time being in Chicago) and both times were truly remarkable. The Montreal property is exceptionally well run, is impeccably clean, has fantastic room service, offers comfortable beds, and has a very friendly staff. All staff members speak both French and English while offer professional service (all with a bright, cheerful smile). The rooms are spacious, clean, well laid out, and the bed/pillows are very comfortable. Do yourself a favor - stay at this hotel. If you speak French (or learning the language as I am) then stay here and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: G0Sabres
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofitel Montreal for 4 nights in January 2006. The hotel was great and we would stay there again in a heartbeat. It was easily on par with some of the other luxury hotels in the area, but at half the price. We got a great deal on hotels.com. We had a corner room, very well appointed. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was impressive. They had a very adequate fitness center. The front desk was very helpful suggesting restaurants and helping us navigate the underground city. The parking was a bit expensive, but parking in any major city will be. Overall an awesome choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Who do they think they are - Ritz Carlton?”
Reviews.Author: Rugbyplayer1
Reviews.Content: I really resent hotels these days that charge: $15 per day for Internet $11 for a pint of Guinness ($6.50 in Calgary) ...and doesn't have a coffee perc in the room in order to force you to use room service at $10 per large pot. (+plus the room service charge and the "gratuity", like - thanks for the "service" Sofitel!) Rooms were great, service in restaurant and bar excellent, but they boost the rev par by gouging customers for these things that we are now taking for granted. I get free hi-speed and a coffee machine in a Days Inn for Pete's sake! I will never voluntarily stay at a Sofitel, Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, all of whom feel that they can grind their customers like this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, location is great (right in the centre), and very good service. A well-recommended hotel to stay. (if I had to criticise one thing, it would be the Hotel/restaurant Renoir.. service is poor and food VERY expensive. I personnally thing it is overstated and not worth it. It is better to go in a restaurant downtown.

Reviews.Title: “loved the stay”
Reviews.Author: gelalin
Reviews.Content: rooms are not that big..but loved everything else about it!! very very clean...convenient location, great environment and great staff...must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mahme
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Sofitel Beds are the best. - Room was very spacious (two armchairs, one desk, large bathroom w/ separate shower) - Turndown Service, was excellent - Housekeeping responded to all my requests very quickly - Concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. Recommended a few very good restaurants - Valet was very efficient at bringing my car up front when I asked for it - Overall, staff was very friendly Disappointents: - The Fitness room is tiny and a little dull - The room only had a pair of slippers, though two guests were staying in the rooms. Housekeeping had a second pair brought up within 3minutes. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The lobby is very cosy and has a nice collection of books (beautiful art and photography books). The service was excellent and the rooms were very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tio-man
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights which was a very nice experience. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull. The guys at the door know everything about Montreal and they're happy to share their knowledge. My room was very large and very clean. The bathroom was one of the nicest (and biggest) I've ever seen. Breakfast was very good, but it takes some time to get it. Having breakfast in less then 30 minutes is impossible. You have to order from a menu. A lot of choice. No buffet. Location of the hotel is very good. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: BostonMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: I never understood Canada's hotel star rating system. It seems that all the hotels have either three stars or four stars and they are pretty much the same. I had stayed in various chain hotels in Vancouver, Ottawa, Toronto and Montreal and they were truly unremarkable with nothing to write home about. My wife and I stayed at the Montreal Sofitel hotel for three nights in early October. Finally, we found a hotel in Montreal that is clearly a cut above the others in Montreal that I had stayed in.
