First, the hotel is in a good location but then most of the large hotels in that city are. Sofitel's staff was extremely friendly and personable, reminded me of good hotels in Europe. All services were prompt and professional. The breakfast was quite refined and upscale. The hotel is nicely decorated and well polished. It does not have the usual "looking good but a bit run-down" scene like a few hotels in Montreal. The bed was truly heavenly. The size of the room was along the line of regular run-of-the-mill but the bathroom was large and posh. However, I did have to upgrade to a different room in order to get a bathtub and showers. Apparently, some of their rooms have standalone showers only. I'd definitely recommend this hotel over the others especially if the prices are similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: kkthepeach
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel. The hotel was in a great location....we walked to Mont Royal, the Musee des Beaux Arts, and the shopping nightlife on Rue St. Catherine's. Also, only 2 blocks to catch the metro. The room was very nice, with a very comfy bed, although it did dip and I almost fell off the side both nights. Bathroom was very large and modern. I enjoyed dessert and after dinner drinks in the bar in the lobby. Great service there. It was noisy- fire engines roared down Sherbrooke about 6 times during the night and woke me up everytime. The room that abutted our room was host to 2 dogs that yapped for 2 hours until we called the front desk to complain, and then they miraculously stopped. I'm not sure what they did with the dogs! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: anonymous43
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Oct 11 to 14 2007. Family of 4 with 2 teenage daughters. We had the quad room with 2 double beds. Usually, in other hotels, the quad rooms have 2 queen beds. These beds were small and tilted outwards. Had to be careful not to roll off. The size of the room was large which is why I can't understand the small beds. All the staff was extremely polite with the exception of the staff in the dining room. On our first morning in the restaurant I had to ask for coffee 3 times. I asked the waitress if I could have something a little different than what was on the menu, such as a grilled sandwich or something less heavy than what they offered, but she said they were too busy and the chef would say no as he was preparing to switch over to the lunch menu. There were only 3 tables with diners, so I couldn't figure out the "busy" comment. Also there must have been 20 staff members walking around acting as if they were "working". Finally I ordered a $12 soup which was average. Needless to say, we never set foot in there again during our stay!! This also happened to other family members who were traveling with us but on a different occassion. They had to ask for coffee 4 times!! Won't stay there again, many other hotels near by.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: Dave7702
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed in Sofitel over Colbus Day weekend. Got good deal through hotel website, probably I assume because tourist season is largely over. This hotel admittedly caters more to a business crowd. That being said, the hotel is centrally located. Very easy to walk either to St. Catherine, Boul St. Laurent or up to Mont Royal. Service at the hotel was very good, bed unimaginably comfortable, and nice bar area. Somewhat pricey at the bar and never tried the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate comfort, quiet, convenient...”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in Montreal is a sleek, modernist business-class hotel that's only a block from McGill University and right at the top of the central business and shopping district. Rooms are quiet and comfortable (though you should ask for a room not facing the front), amenities are pleasant, and the front desk staff and concierge were very efficient. The only thing I can fault was the expensive prix fixe, three-course menu that our group of six (all hotel guests) was forced to order from, in the hotel dining room. Unfortunately the food was a bit esoteric if not pretentious, and the quality not up to the level of the cost. This might have worked in Beverly Hills, California, but a business class hotel in downtown Montreal should have a dining room or cafe that offers mainstream fare at reasonable prices. Room service also disappointed slightly, with a pot of lukewarm coffee (which was promptly remedied).

Reviews.Title: “We liked Sofitel --few issues”
Reviews.Author: MaxandLola
Reviews.Content: Generally an excellent hotel in a great location on Rue Sherbrooke. The rooms are modern with very comfortable beds and bedding. Nice size modern bathrooms. Lots of storage space. The room had floor to ceiling windows but not a super view--apartment right across the street. The very modern lobby was very attractive . The lobby had 2 computers in a little nook, that were mostly always in use. The room appeared to be very clean---but we were kind of grossed-out when upon opening a fresh robe we found lots of hair snippets on the collar- like someone had a haircut in it and it wasn't washed. The Hotel did replace it rather quickly after being told of it. That, and a wobbly toilet were the only problems we had. Every staff member encountered was extremely pleasant and helpful. Despite these minor things I would go back to the Sofitel---realizing it is a good 4 star, but not close to a five star.

Reviews.Title: “The Sofitel ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl29
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at The Sofitel for my bachelorette party the third week in August. It was a fantastic location for this event as it was close to all the shopping on St. Catherines st. and all the bars/clubs and restaurants on Crescent st. Both venues were a mere 10 minutes away, saving us a ton on cab rides! The room was small to average size - we had booked 2 queens in our room, but the bathroom was HUGE - lots of marble, a soaker tub and glass enclosed shower. No rain showerhead though in ours. The beds are sooo incredibly comfortable, that 2 people in our group went to Simons and bought the pillows! Parking was around $30/night I think? Valet with in/out privileges. Concierge was fantastic and managed to secure a reservation for 10 of us at Garde Manger in Old Montreal, when our head party planner could not even get them to pick up the phone at the restaurant! Loved the bar for their typical pricey drinks. But they had a good selection of cocktails, delicious nuts, olives and an amuse bouche. Perfect after a long day of shopping. Room Service menu was sparse and definitely lacking. I've seen better at other luxury hotels. I would definitely stay at the Sofitel again - purely for the location and comfy beds/contemporary decor.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPair
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy at the Sofitel. It is centrally located, within an easy walk of two metro lines, lots of places to eat and lots of shopping. The room was small, but had everything we wanted, had views from two sides, and was extremely quiet. The rain-shower shower head was a nice touch and towels were freshened during the evening turn-down service. The staff was extremely helpful, although the concierge seemed surprised when we preferred to take the metro/walk rather than take a cab. The bar staff was very friendly and the continental breakfast, while expensive, easily serves two people. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cbn2104
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the worst hotel experience of my life. I had my cash and credit cards stolen from my room while I went to the lobby for 5 minutes and over $1500 worth of fraudulent charges racked up on my accounts within minutes. The management, while admitting housekeeping had entered my room twice for no apparent reason after I checked in, of course would take no responsibility. The carpet was filthy and there were stains all over the baseboards. Would expect a cleaner room from a "luxury" hotel. The mattresses sagged and were very uncomfortable. If you have to stay here, use the safe. I would recommend the Delta Centre Ville or the Intercontinental instead.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: meprice82
Reviews.Content: It was fantastic! Great location, great services and wonderful views. Everything was CLEAN and modern. Staff and concierge were very friendly and extremely helpful. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dragon252pi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary. It was our first trip to Montreal. Neither one of us can say enough good about the staff. They were the best. From directions to late night stores and restaurants, they knew it all. We were able to plan our days efficiently with their help. Most places we were able to walk to. When you are in the old city stop by Casa de Mateo for excellent Mexican food at a reasonable price. It is on Saint Francois Xavier. Two others we recommend are on Peel St. They are the Peel Pub and La Belle Province. Both supply an ample portion of food for a very pocket friendly price. My wife and I will definitely revisit Montreal again. PS- avoid the Casino, it sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: KitchaMitcha
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a nice hotel. We're good walkers and made it to Chinatown and the vieux port on foot from the Sofitel, but if you had kids along it would probably be too far from everywhere you want to be. The room was tiny as was the bathroom, but both were good quality and very clean. The bed linens were the best...I wish I had those at my house. We really enjoyed the nice view from the room. Parking was way too expensive but I didn't notice any other options nearby. I wouldn't bother eating at the restaurant unless breakfast was included as ours was. BTW, if you go to the official Montreal website they have hotel deals that actually are a deal. And we got a little gift to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the room was very quiet. The decor was great - especially the bathroom. Location was good although a bit of a walk to Old Montreal but you can buy day travel passes on the underground for $8.50 which makes the trip only about 10 mins. The hotel staff were very friendly although the concierge wasn't that helpful. He only recommended restaurants and bars that were in a 5 min radius of the hotel!! We went out for breakfast every day and I would recommend Eggspectation for it's huge choice of fab breakfasts. Although go to the one in Old Montreal (Rue St Jacques) not the one on Rue St Catherine as the staff are a lot friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel, so of course we must like it. This time around what really stood out was the very friendly and efficient staff. We had a package that included breakfast, and we also had a drink in the bar. This increased our exposure to the staff and every contact was excellent. This is our preferred choice when staying downtown and not in Old Montreal. The reasons are simple. The rooms are very nice with a modern look, and floor to ceiling windows. The bathrooms are large and luxurious with marble, and most with separate shower and tub. The beds, as many have commented, are very comfortable. The location is also great, close to the metro, shopping, and restaurants. A walk to Old Montreal will take you about twenty minutes. The hotel restaurant and bar are sleek looking and have outdoor seating available during the warm weather months. The hotel gym is nice but very small. In a corner of the lobby is an internet center available free to guests, a nice amenity that we wished more hotels provided. One thing to be aware of is that there do not seem to be any connecting rooms, but the doors to the hallway are loud when they close. One suggestion for the hotel management is that it is time to replace the old TVs and put in some flat screens to enhance the modern look of the rooms. There are a lot of great boutique hotels in Old Montreal but if your choice is the center of town, then the Sofitel is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisey”
Reviews.Author: CD001
Reviews.Content: At the risk of being the person who gives a hotel a 3 out of 5 and doesn't have anything substantial to back it up; the Sofitel Montreal is a very nice hotel. The beds are extremely comfortable, the rooms are quite nice & the restaurant was also great. A few minor issues were annoying enough that I likley won't return. Perhaps we were just unlucky, but we had a very noisey room. I am not a light sleeper and was awoken to the sounds of doors slamming & hotel staff talking loudly in the halls. We were there for 4 nights & had the same problem every day. This is a show stopper in my mind, hotels are for sleeping, if you cannot do this there is a problem. The second issue was our key card, on two different nights it wouldn't work. Not a huge deal, but after a few beverages and a late night marching back down to reception was quite annoying. The reception seemed to be aware of the issue, which makes you wonder why they don't fix it. Our third and final beef was the $15/day internet charge. We have traveled extensively throughout the world and have never paid such a high fee. You know when you just feel like you are getting ripped off? We would likely try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh the Beds”
Reviews.Author: gringo59
Reviews.Content: Once again Tripadvisor has come up trumps. I have found nothing to fault in this hotel and as previous reviewers have raved the Sofitel has enormous and possibly the most comfortable beds anywhere. Pillowtop plus if such a thing exists! Don`t know if its a coincidence but even the Neutrogena products that a previous reviewer disliked appear to have been replaced. The staff (and there are a lot of them) are very friendly, helpful and in a city with a confusing number of great dining opportunities, the concierge and his team identified very memorable dining experiences for me. Its easy sometimes when travelling alone to find large chain hotels impersonal and unfriendly but I have felt very well looked after indeed here. You can book the Sofitel with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 7 Hour Drive”
Reviews.Author: FunInTheSun423
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Montreal with my boyfriend from March 30th-April1st. Being a fan of tripadvisor, I rely on it for all my trips and I must say it was a very pleasant stay. The hotel itself is very pretty and clean, the room was a bit on the small side, however everything else was great. They have the most comfortable beds that I've ever had the privilege to sleep on in a hotel. The bathrooms are really nice, marble from ceiling to floor. The staff was very friendly and always ready to help. I would recommend it to anyone who goes to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: Gruver
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Montreal is a nice hotel. The public spaces and the restaurant Renoir and Le Bar are beautiful and contemporary. The rooms and service, however, leave a bit to be desired. While I suspect most people would find the hotel, and its rooms and facilities acceptable, if not enjoyable on any level, hotel snobs be warned that there are some areas for improvement. For those people I will note the good and the bad. First, the bed and bed linens are fantastic -- better than the Ritz Cartlon chain's. There are a few drawbacks to the room itself. We stayed in a deluxe room and found it a bit small and the furnishings a bit ikea-ish. The bath, with separate shower and tub, was quite attractive, but the bath products were Neutrogena and the tub was not large. Turndown service was hit or miss -- sometimes not occurring at all; and the morning paper was delivered quite late in the morning. So, you can get a great sleep, good food and good cocktails at the Sofitel, but don't expect the world. Think hip new Hyatt, not Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: macbethLivingston
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Quebec Tourism for four days in May. Their Sweet Deal included 2-person breakfast for 2 days and reduced room rate. This superb hotel is located 2 blocks from McGill University and the metro, 2 blocks from St. Catherine Street (the hip and happening address), with many moderately priced restaurants in a 2-block area. Our large room on the 16th floor faced west (towards the park), accommodated 3 adults in 2 beds, and had huge closets with mirrored doors. The bathroom, in grey, white and black marble, was oversized and spotless. Heavy terrycloth robes and slippers were a nice touch. Although breakfast in Renoir restaurant was expensive, our "deal" allowed us to eat there twice. The food and service was outstanding -- it is worth the price for such exquisite cuisine. The concierge had excellent recommendations for nearby restaurants and daily outings. The spa had many exercise machines and a sauna. Three computers offered Internet service for free just off the lobby. The eclectic decor added to our complete enjoyment of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chiorazzi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern and comfortable and what is most noticeable is the service and attitude of those who work there. A professionalism,sincerety and willingness to help that is not easily found in the US. Bed was comfortable and the Internet service in the lobby appreciated. Lighting in the room was surperb. Thanks Simon (the conceirge) for letting me use your computer when the others were occupied. I did not like that the bathroom door didn't close completely. Weird design but otherwise A +++

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Caguas1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel Montreal for 5 days last week in March and we will return in the summer. The staff goes out if its way to make you feel at home . The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The hotel rooms are super clean , super quiet . And you cant beat the location which is walking distance from Hip Cresent st and a block away from Peel Metro station. To top it off we had a safe desposit box in the closet that made us feel extra safe with out passports and money . KUDOS TO SOFITEL

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Mcmullens
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the good advice from trip advisor. We stayed four nights at this lovely hotel and enjoyed the location, the clean, spacious, quiet and well apointed room. The bed was very comfortable. I requested synthetic pillows and a top sheet and my needs were met quickly. The service was helpful and the valet parking was convenient. My car was available quickly when needed. Some tips.......If you have allergies, bring your own soap. Scentless soaps were not available. Breakfast was expensive at the hotel , and the suggestion for eggspectation was ok, but too much food. I found that next door the best western had a take out coffee and toast, muffins etc. Very convienient and reasonably priced. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Tokalosh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March 07. After missing our connecting flight to Cassablanca and spending 10 hours to travel the usual one hour from Toronto to Montreal, we were relieved to check into this wonderful hotel. Accomodations are modern, bright and spacious. Staff were very helpful in arranging flights for us. We ate a late breakfast in the restaurant. Food was incredible and service excellent. We would definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: mariusbaa
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel in Montreal is located on Rue Sheerbroock (?), not too far from the places everything is happening. What impressed me from the start was the beautiful lobby, which comes in a nice combination of dark marble, wood and glass. My room was on the 4th floor, a little tiny in my eyes. But the design was good, the bed was spacious and very soft. The bathroom did not have a tub, but the walk-in shower did the job quite well. My rate included free webaccess and free continental breakfast. The breakfast was really good, very French in fact. They serve fresh coffee in bodum presses, which makes it taste good. Overall, I must say it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mariehd1985
Reviews.Content: I stay there for only a night but it was beautiful!! We had a beautiful buisness class at the 16th floors!! The only bad thing was that in the mini bar the soda can was 4,75 CAN$!!! We order the dinner in the room from the Renoir hotel restaurant, it was good!! I really recommand this hotel!! A++++

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: SueLoo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend lives in Montreal just four blocks away from the Sofitel but planned a romantic weekend getaway at the hotel on one of my trips up from New York City. It was everything we hoped it would be. Great service, though the concierge was a bit snotty when asked about local dining options, and the room was lovely. The room's decor lent itself to a relaxing atmosphere and the bathroom was perfect (separate shower and bath). Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Oasis in a Chilly City”
Reviews.Author: Bondgirl70
Reviews.Content: As a business and vacation traveller from NYC, I have sought out Sofitel Hotels as an excellent choice for a consistent, clean and well serviced hotel in many US cities. When my husband and I chose to get away from the usual family hubbub for a long weekend over the busy Thanksgiving Holiday, by driving to Montreal, we booked the Sofitel naturally. Not only because we had excellent stays in other Sofitel hotels in the past, but the ratings for the Montreal Sofitel was so favorable on Trip Advisor. When we arrived, after a lovely drive through the Adirondacks of New York State, we were greeted by friendly, bilingual doorman "Buon Jour!" and check-in desk service people. Everyone was consistently friendly and always tried their best to deliver ideal service. From the first hello, to the waitstaff in the bar/lounge and the goodbye packing up our car, all were kind and personable. The room we had reserved at a very competitive rate, was clean as always and well appointed. We had a corner room on a high floor which afforded us two walls of windows, a large L-shaped room, ridiculously wonderful bed and stylish bathroom. (Has anyone seen nicer bathrooms at any hotels in the same price range as Sofitel?) The maid service was very kind and attentive, delivering weather reports, bottles of evian and chocolates every evening. Something I always seek is peace and quiet in a hotel, especially in a busy city, and this Sofitel delivered. We never heard anyone in the halls or in their neighboring rooms and the hotel was quite full. Location was great and the bar/lounge area was very nice. I have to state a couple of downsides, so here they are: 1. The restaurant, Picasso, while quite elegant and very french, didn't really have that extensive a menu. The first night there, we wanted to use their guest card for a free cocktail, but the bar and restaurant was packed with a convention meeting booked for the night. Why have the area open, if you can't get in? We recommend the Sofitel in Montreal highly to anyone looking for a nice getaway from the states. Its smart, stylish, fun and definitely the best you can get for your dollar. Tres Bien!

Reviews.Title: “first class all the way”
Reviews.Author: grinandbearit
Reviews.Content: Wow, stayed at the holiday inn express downtown for a few days which was great, then business took me to the sofitel for a few days. Wow! I do not stay at first class hotels to often and what a treat it was. Great service from the second we left our car, the doormen were prof. the desk staff was prof. the room staff was prof. people who seemed to enjoy their work...what a concept. The Hotel is an old converted office building that opened I think about five years ago. It is centrally located on sherbrooke street close to st. catherine street (shopping) cresent street and mckay street(bars every where) (restaurants everywhere). Close to shopping malls(cours mount royal is one) for those cold winter nights and the famous st. catherine street is just a few blocks away. You can even walk to the bell center to watch a hockey game if you don't mind walking abit. The rooms were small but the beds were like sleeping on a cloud, it was so soft and fluffy that it was hard to see the person next to you...well almost. The bathrooms were super clean marble throughout and the shower had a hand held and a overhead rain shower....hmmm heaven, all surrounded by floor to ceiling glass doors. the windows overlooking the city where also floor to ceiling and when the sun did come out the view was pretty spectacular. I am not sure if we were on the other side if we would have been able to see mount royal or if buildings would block that view. It would be worth asking i am sure the view would be spectacular. For those of you who like to hit a morning run you have trails going up to mount royal right behind the hotel that are challenging and safe for all joggers(remember it still is a big city) The restaurant in the hotel was top notch but your selection of eateries within close proximity to the hotel are unlimited. from hot dog joints to 5 star restaurants, oh ,and a starbucks just down the street. The hotel is expensive but if you want to kick back for a few days and impress your partner(s) then this would be the place. .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: DMW73
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay in the Sofitel in August. Beautiful rooms,and good service in a fantastic location. Friendly and professional valet service. One of the best breakfasts in Montreal. The only small problem was that we had booked all 4 of our rooms on Expedia, and breakfast was to be included, but for some reason the hotel would only provide breakfast vouchers for 3 of the rooms, even though there were 5 people staying in the 4 rooms. It wasn't clear why some rooms came with vouchers, and others did not, considering they all were booked at the same time and for the same rate. We reached a compromise, where the hotel agreed to pay for 4 of the 5 breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “First time, not last”
Reviews.Author: Breezey
Reviews.Content: With a daughter at McGill, we have tried various hotels while visiting Montreal but the Sofitel always seemed a place we have wanted to try. Well, great for us; too bad for the other hotels. Cannot imagine staying anywhere else. The staff are professional and charming, the rooms, while not particulary large are clean, nicely decorated and have wonderful comfy linens, duvets and pillows. And the bathroom is great. While we didnt have a chance to try the restaurant, fitness room, etc; we love how the lobby iis aglow in candles at night; hallways have potpourri, so lovely smells when you get off the elevator; ample television channel choice in the room and a terrific location. Sofitel will now be our hotel of choice in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: Stayed a monday and tuesday at two different rates for each night ($172ca and $156ca). Room was compact but perfectly appointed with every luxury. Bathroom amenities are wonderful as is the seperate shower with the rain head. The bed is blissfully comfortable with feather mattresses and duvets to disappear into. Hotel restaurant is expensive for breakfast, however what a breakfast! High end delicious with wonderful service to match. Room service is excellent as well.Only complaint is that they charge an extra $15.00 Ca every 24hrs for Internet access which is really tacky in this day and age as opposed to no charge or one charge for the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superior in every way!”
Reviews.Author: FromHomeToWorld
Reviews.Content: Our entire experience at this hotel was excellent. We arrived at 11:45 am and figured we would just drop our bags and car and walk around the city until we could check in. To our complete surprise our room was ready (before noon!) and we were greeted warmly, checked-in quickly and before we knew it we had dropped our bags in our room, freshened up and were out enjoying the city. The room wasn't huge but was furnished and decorated beautifully, from the featherbed to the marble bath to the candle in the entryway. We usually stay at the Omni when we're in Montreal but we have certainly found our new favorite and will definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “I Love this Hotel Chain!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra1218
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Sofitel locations, and each keep getting better and better. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel chain. It can be pricey depending on the season but you pay what you get for. The service, food, amenities etc are exquisite. Definitely worth it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Know Why Sofitel Is Not #1”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sofitel during her parent's 50th anniversary weekend. We sometimes stay at the parents house, but the foam on the basement floor wears thin after 17 years of parental visits - wonderful as they are. I have often stayed in Montreal on business or other visits, and have stayed in a number of hotels, notably the Fairmont many times, the Vogue and several others. The Sofitel may not have free internet access and other freebees offered by other big chains - but what it does have is rooms that are incredibly clean and fresh; beds and linens that are to die for; rooms that are VERY quiet (you never hear anyone beside or above you), bathrooms that are actually big enough to move around in and some (not quite all) staff that are very attentive. We were there for 3 nights, and after the first day the doorman knew my name. The valet parking is swift, and cost in line with any other downtown hotel. The location is one of the best - and even though our room faced busy Sherbrooke street, the traffic sounds were not too disturbing. Still I would go for a room at the "back" of the hotel next time. You are steps from McGill, Holt Renfrew, the major art Museums, Crecent Street and the downtown core. The hallways have a wonderful pot-pourrie that form some reason reminds me of Hawaii. Don't know what it is but want it for my hallways at home. Agree with other posts that recommend walking a few blocks to the Eggspectation for a great breakfast at a reasonable cost. Be prepared for a busy spot - it's very popular among Montrealers. Don't be shy - 2 can often jump the line that may be standing around the front door. I am sure there are other places nereby - you are in the heart of downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Accommodating, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: YazBeanSaysMeow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Montreal for five nights this August and truly enjoyed the experience. We booked directly through their website and got a special non-refundable Internet rate for a suite for $255 (CAD)/night. Check-in was simple and we were assigned a corner suite, 620, without much of a view (didn't really matter to us). Decor is modern, bathroom is unbelievably great. Marble/granite floors with soaking tub, separate shower, two-sink vanity, bathrobes, slippers, lovely amenities. High-speed Internet access was $15 (CAD)/day. Bed was incredibly comfortable and we're considering buying it for our home. Because of our schedules, we spent lots of time in the room and maid service was very accommodating. They would call us at 3PM to ask us if we needed our room cleaned, and we would frequently just request new towels at turndown. (If you saw the Trip Advisor review saying maid service only upon request, that wasn't our experience.) Front desk will change up to $100 daily to CAD at OK exhange rates without a processing fee. We had originally reserved the Ritz-Carlton Montreal but after reading the reviews on this site switched to the Sofitel. Was very pleased and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absaloutly Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Zahya
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the best hotels we have been to. The hotel was beautiful. Large spacious rooms, large marbled bathrooms which even has a seperate glass shower. And oh my those beds...they sell their famous feather filled duvets, once u sleep in one of them u melt into the bed!! Great friendly service. We were even given lots of free bottles of Evian mineral water every evening!!! YES EVIAN!!!! No complaints....extra tip...skip breakfast at the hotel and walk a couple of blocks to Eggspectations, for a great value filling breakfast that keeps u full till dinner time!!

Reviews.Title: “dont book third party”
Reviews.Author: mickey1234
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotels[-]. The promo rate was 133 a night and that was to include breakfast. The next morning I went down for breakfast but was told my rate was a bargin rate and did not include breakfast. I had to deal with Hotels[-] for a while before getting it resolved and we never did get the breakfast (hotels[-] issued me a credit for the breakfast amt, which by the way was 22 dollars a person for a continental breakfast!!!! ie. juice and muffin....so I guess I am glad they lost the info) However I had to ask several times to get a cup of coffee. Evidently the hotel only puts out complimentary coffee until 7:30 am! Who gets up that early on vacation? After 7:30 one has to go to the restaraunt and pay through the nose for a cup, I thought this was a four star hotel? One the other side of things the location is great, the service is excellent. The hotel as well is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, luxurious bathroom, extra services very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Primula
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here the beginning of August in a deluxe room. Our original plan was to stay at the Residence Inn, but because of a mix-up in the reservation we booked this hotel last minute for about the same price. The room was very nice and bright and had a very luxurious bath with a lighted mirror and a smaller magnifying makeup mirror and the bath had marble floors and shower surround and a separate tub. The counter was black granite however the counter space was a little skimpy. The beds had wonderful luxurious bedding, however the layer that was on top of the mattress ( felt like an extra duvet) made it a little too soft for me, and probably for most people that might have back problems. The carpet had several small stains as you enter the room, but overall I thought the cleanliness was good. I thought the room was a good value, ( I think we got it for less than some because we booked it at the last minute and they had dropped the prices.) Everything else at this hotel was very expensive and everything was an add on including in-room internet. We spent 50 dollars for breakfast the first morning and after that we scouted for cheaper alternatives. We found a Van Houtte cafe on 2020 Rue Stanley that was not great but ok . We found it hard to find a decent, reasonably priced place near there for breakfast. It would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room. Room service coffee was also very expensive. The parking was ten dollars more per night than at the Residence Inn . Overall the people were friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is really good, right near good restaurants and close to the subway. There were a couple of charges that were in error, one from the in -room bar and the other for a movie we didn't watch, but they were removed once we called their attention to them. One night we ate at Garcon, right across the street . This restaurant is excellent, although pricey. We also ate at Cavalli at 2040 Rue Peel. We felt this place was a rip-off. The food was ok, not exceptional and the prices were higher than at Garcon.

Reviews.Title: “'A la carte' is French for 'read the fine print.'”
Reviews.Author: jackfurlongesq_123
Reviews.Content: So we were looking for a last-minute weekend getaway, and Montreal seemed an easy drive north to escape the oppressive heat in NJ. We chose Sofitel based on knowledge of the brand, plus reader reviews at TripAdvisor. It is, indeed, a modern business hotel a couple of blocks south of University, within walking distance of Vieux Montreal if you like a long walk. (There is no shortage of taxis and easy underground access if you don't.) Looking for a promotional rate, we found a suite on Sofitel's 16th floor (17 is their penthouse, and there is no 13th floor) at $255 Canadian/night if you prepaid, non-refundable. We booked three nights, wondering what allegedly five-star hotel was giving away dramatic suites at that price, regardless of terms. Upon arrival, we got our answer. First, the web site offers an add-on flat rate for breakfast, but you cannot book it online. We paid for our room and then asked for the breakfast package. The desk clerk advised that since we had just processed our payment, we were no longer eligible for the breakfast part of the package. I asked about the "free high-speed Internet." That turns out to be two computers at an open desk in the lobby, both of which appeared to be permanently occupied. If you want Internet in your room, that's $15/day. "Is any part of the hotel wi-fi?" "Yes, the lobby, but that's $15/half-day." You get the picture. The suite was cramped, but it's tough to complain at $255Can. The sitting room was little more than a walk-in closet with a small desk. The bedroom had the dimensions of a room at your basic W (W Hotels set the bar for cramped). There was an extravagant bathroom, but it was so chopped up (hard to describe, but a kind of 'Z' shape floor plan) that it lost whatever cache it might have had. The room was clean, quiet, and the floor smoke-free. Smoke-free turns out to be a huge amenity in Canada's answer to Tobacco Road. Getting a dinner table away from the city's legion of chain smokers proved nigh impossible. This is not the format to report on Montreal's shortcomings, but we cut our trip short after one night. Of course we did not expect a refund for the pre-paid room (and luckily, we weren't allowed to pre-pay for breakfast), but we should not have had to demand a valet parking credit, and one would have thought a discerning clerk would have asked, "Was everything all right?" No such luck. No complaints, but no return either.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Littlesheep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel in Montreal during the long weekend and loved the hotel. The room was modern and clean. The location of the hotel is very close to major shopping stores. The bed was so comfortable and I was able to sleep well on this trip. Everything at this hotel is pricy. They only have valet parking which cost $26 per night. We enjoyed the breakfast but found pricy too. When we got seated at the table, the waiter asked us for orange juice and coffee. I thought it was included in the breakfast but it wasn't. The orange juice and coffee cost $8 per person. We walked to Old Montreal but coming back to the hotel on foot was tiring. We will definitely stay at Sofitel in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NotAMonet
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Sofitel for a week and we loved it! The design is modern and sophisticated, reminiscent of a W hotel but brighter and more cheery. The staff is very friendly. Every time we entered the lobby, someone was there to hold the door for us, get the elevator and offer a warm "bonjour." The concierge was great in helping my friend with his lost luggage and making dinner reservations or suggestions. The lobby music was hip and calming. There are two computers that you can use to check email and surf the net. I like hotels that pay attention to the small details. The candels mentioned in a previous review are definitely a nice touch, as are the complementary apples at the front desk. Twice daily maid service is nice too. The maid leaves behind free, small bottles of water. The soaps, bath gel, and toiletries are all very nice. I barely used the stuff I brought myself. I loved my room, which was larger than my friends' room because of the fact that it was a corner room, I imagine. (Request room #818 if you can.) The bathroom has a sink which is basically a porcelain bowl on top of the counter (looks really cool). It also has a shower with two shower heads (a removeable hand-held one and an overhead rain shower). The bed is super comfortable! As for the gym, it's true that it's not large. We had read that the Omni a block away had a nicer gym and (because we enjoy working out) we considered switching to the Omni...that is until we saw it. It just wasn't worth sacrificing a MUCH more comfortable stay at the Sofitel just for a bigger gym, which really wasn't all that nice. So instead we purchased day passes at a gym less than a block away for $20 CAD. I can't remember the name, but the hotel staff can tell you. It's a very nice gym and well worth the extra expense: extensive free weights, cybex, cardio machines, pool, towels provided, locker rooms with sauna and steam rooms. The works! We ate breakfast every morning at this place a couple of blocks away called Eggspectations. They have a HUGE menu of all kinds of breakfast foods. We didn't use the bar or restaurant at the hotel, but I wish we had. They both looked nice and, like the hotel, very well designed. I did order room service twice, and both times it was prompt and delicious. The hotel is only a block away from the metro, making it really easy to get around the city. Don't even consider staying at the Ritz Carlton a block away. One of my friends stayed there for a few nights for a business meeting before we checked into the Sofitel and he said it was pretty run down. I highly, highly recommend this hotel. When I go back to Montreal, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive hotel and service, almost worth the price!!”
Reviews.Author: EveAndGreg
Reviews.Content: This is really a great hotel. We went with our one-year old son to Montreal for a wedding, and were blown away by the service here. From the moment we pulled up out front, it was friendly, cordial, prompt, efficient service, everything from the valet to check-in to the bellhop. The room was amazing, my wife loved the bathroom and the bedding. They light hundreds of candles throughout the lobby at night for a great effect. One thing that impressed me was that this is obviously a business hotel in many senses, although there are plenty of tourists, and we're there with a baby and sightseeing and going out in shorts and probably looking like slobs, but the service did not appear to suffer one bit, i.e. we were treated like royalty like every other guest. The valet is prompt to bring the car up, and we had room service two mornings and they were excellent. Really we just thought the service was fabulous. Three negatives: the crib they provided for our room was OK, but seemed oddly pedestrian for such a fine hotel; the fitness center is sufficient, but lacking again for such a fine hotel; and, the price! Everything is pricey, the valet, the rooms, the food, the bar, the mini-bar - but you get what you pay for and it was probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort and Style”
Reviews.Author: magginine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Sofitel every time we visit Montreal, which is twice a year. The location is superb, close to shopping on Ste. Catherine, in the boutique area on Sherbrooke. The hotel itself is clean and modern, the beds are amazingly comfortable with a featherbed, down duvet and down pillows. We've had a nice view every time we've stayed. The service has also been very good, one time I needed scissors and called down, they came up within 3 minutes. Another time a sewing kit showed up within about 5 minutes. All in all you pay a little more but we feel it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn940
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel 5 nights the end of January. The hotel is very centrally located and within easy walking distance of most downtown sites. The hotel staff (front desk, concierge, housekeeping and restaurant staff) were friendly, helpful and efficient. I had a corner room which was very quiet, luxurious bed, heavenly pillows and more than enough fluffy towels. Bed was turned down nightly with a bottle of Evian left on the night stand and a phalaenopsis orchard in the vase. The only thing I found a little disconcerting was the coconut potpourri/air freshener. I am not a big fan of coconut. Other than that a great stay. Planning to go back to Montreal late summer and will definitely stay at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alex030
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay ( 4 nights). Spacious room with floor to ceiling windows. Room ( deluxe room ) was epitome of understated elegance. Absolutely spotless. Staff very attentive, very knowledgeable concierge. Superb location, next to Museum and Metro station. I see myself as fairly picky; simply couldn't find a single fault. I am tired of 3 and 4 star hotels parading as 5 star hotels; this is truly a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_Boy
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat hesitant to book the Sofitel Montreal, given my poor experiences with their sister chain, Novotel, in the past. My fears seemed to materialize when I was told that the hotel's system did not have my reservation. After producing my reservation confirmation, we soon realized that my reservation was indeed in the system, and it was just that the hotel captured the wrong client name. Other than this initial glitch, the remainder of my experience at Sofitel Montreal was superb. The staff were all professional and friendly (particular kudos go to the valet staff during my stay). The hotel was kept immaculately clean and the rooms were well appointed. This was one of the few hotels where I was able to actually get work done in my hotel room (good lighting, work-friendly desk, chair, etc.). The hotel is modern but also has classical overtones in its decor. The location is superb given that it is situated at Sherbrooke and Peel, steps away from the main shopping district as well as the Metro. In a city where the quality of hotels seem to get better with every passing year, Sofitel Montreal can certainly be ranked as one of the elite hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but.......”
Reviews.Author: jmalux
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Montreal is indeed a very nice hotel but I fail to see that it is so wonderful as other reviewers claim. We stayed for five nights in a suite. The suite itself was very spacious but I found the decor rather bland. The carpet had several big stains (red wine etc.) which had been removed without much success. We found a thick layer of dust on top of the closets and we had to make two requests to have it removed. There is a rainshower but the water pressure was so poor that we couldn't use it. Instead we used the normal shower head. Great toiletries. The bed is among the best I have ever tried. The gym is in a tiny closed room and not really a place where you want to stay for long. The equipment is OK and there is free fruit and water. Overall a very OK experience but the small annoyances kill the luxury feeling.

Reviews.Title: “A True Luxury Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a long weekend (w/o the kids) getaway to montreal..We found a deal online whereby we got three nights with the 3d night at 1/2 price..We chose the Sofitel because o the great reviews we read online. We were VERY impressed. The hotel is on Rue Sherbrooke which is like Montreal's version of NYC's 5th or Park Ave. Mont Royal park is one block away as is the metro (which is wonderful, fast, perfect)--the hotel room was beautiful--marble bath with tun and marble stall shower--very large, big thirst towels--BUT, the best part off all was the BED--there wer 4 king size very expensive down pillows which were sol big and soft that we could not leave the bed--and under us was an enormous lush down featherbed--you will not want to go home after sleeping in this bed--trust me---the last night we stayed we had to wake up very early for a flight back to jfk at 6am so we were up and in lobby by 4:30--I asked about coffee and, within seconds, a cart came out with a huge silver urn of coffee and service for two and a waiter wearing white gloves!!! pretty impressive

Reviews.Title: “Despite an bumpy start...a great ending”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Sofitel last week for a 3-night stay. We drove up from Boston and upon our initial arrival we were very disappointed to find out that despite having a booked reservation through expedia our room was not available because the hotel had been "overbooked". The front desk staff was extremely apologetic and made arrangements for us to stay at the nearby Sheraton--a few blocks away on Rue Sherbrooke. Despite being placed in a suite for the first night we were very disappointed...obviously the Sheraton was nowhere near the caliber of hotel we were used to or what we were expecting at the Sofitel. We informed the Sofitel of how unhappy we were and I must say that from that moment forward they made every possible arrangement to make us happy. They started by upgrading us to a junior suite at the Sofitel for our return on the second night. The remainder of our stay was spectacular. That evening the night manager sent us a fruit plate and an apology note for the previous night's events. The concierge was wonderful...he made reservations for us at two local restaurants that were great. I highly recommend Le Blanc in the French Quarter and a very stylish italian restaurant by the name of Cavalli (just a few blocks away from the hotel). We were greeted at both restaurants with a smile....they VIP'd us the entire time we were there. As stated above, despite a bumpy start, the sofitel made every possible arrangement to assure our happiness. THanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights. They were extremely gracious from check-in to check-out. The rooms were stylish and spotless. My girlfriend had a minor medical problem that required attention at about 2am and when we phoned the front desk they immediately had the hotel's doctor phone back (about 5 minutes). He prescribed the appropriate drugs and had the courier deliver it within 1/2 an hour. We didn't even have to leave the room. The hotel and its staff met the highest standards for both service and quality of the property. I can't say enough about this place. If you have the chance to stay there while in Montreal - don't pass it up. I won't!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wxman1969
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel in early July, 2005. Service was extraordinary, the room was small but very clean with lots of extras, the bathroom was among the nicest I had ever seen, and the bed was really comfortable. Parking was steep, $20/day, but I guess that's becoming pretty standard for city hotels. We did not eat in the hotel, but there was a great little breakfast/lunch place just down the street (actually on a side street, but I forget the name) called Vasco de Gama that we ate at every morning we were there. A little pricey, but great food with lots of fresh juice and coffee. I was surprised this place was not in our Fodor's book on Montreal. Speaking of food, avoid Mr. Steer's on St. Catherine at all cost. Amazingly Fodor's gave this a decent review but we just found it awful. Most of the other recommendations were pretty much on target though. Very much liked the bagel place called St. Viateur near Mont Royal. We took a dozen home with us. It was very hot and humid while we were there (90s with humidity about 70 percent). Although the hotel is close to a couple subway stops and is very close to St. Catherine St., we were disappointed that the subway did not stop anywhere near the old part of Montreal near the waterfront. This made for a little bit of a hike, which in most cases would be fine, but in the weater we had it was tough. We were sweating almost immediately. Recommendation: Pack plenty of water with you when you go out during the summer here. A hat would be good too. All in all we were very happy here. I might have opted to stay at a place closer to the old part of town had I known the city layout a little better and the limitations of the subway, but in any case this is a great hotel. Probably caters more towards the business types due to it's proximity to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Sofitel is not with the program.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Sofitels and I would rank the chain in Montreal at the bottom. Sofitel as a chain prides in service and making sure that the customers are content. Montreal does not seem to with the program. They definitely did not deliver what they have advertised. First, we had to wait in the lobby for an indefinite time till the front desk got their act together to let us into our room a little earlier than the 3 o'clock check in. We were then given a room on a non-smoking floor which smells like a smoking room...to add injury to the matter, the room had little drops of blood on the carpet and wall which the cleaning people have missed. My children found them. It went on like this all weekend, with lots of apologies from the management when you talk to them but very slow in action. I would also advise you to take the advise from the consierge with a bit of caution. When I asked him for a route to Old Montreal so that I could walk with my two children, one in elementary school, I was given a route with a street laden with obscene/--- industry. You start to wonder about this management. 4 of us have eaten two meals in their restaurant, lunch and dinne, and rented two rooms for three nights. I was billed close to $2000. I think you can do better else where.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JPang
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel! Great location on Sherbrooke - close to the Musuem of Fine Arts and shopping attractions. I got a room on the 19th floor and had a great view of the neighboring grand mansions (the Ritz-Carlton looked so old and sad from my room). And the bed is one of the best I've slept in (in my opinion, second only to the Peninsula Bangkok... way better than the Westin Heavenly Beds). Staff is professional and exceptionally friendly. The bellman is amazing, who helped me carry my shopping bags up to my room without that "tips please" look/attitude from New York. Room service is delicious and not overly expensive. The complimentary "fruit shots" at breakfast were inspiring. Will return without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay there again!!!! The service was fabulous!!! Anything you needed they would accommodate you as best they could; and majority of the time they accommodated you. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to a majority of amenities (ie. St.Catherine street, where all the shopping is; Cresent street, where all the restaurants and some bars) HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Scuba
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Very European feel. From the moment I entered the lobby I was treated as the most welcomed guest. I checked in and went to my room where I found myself surrounded in comfort and clean efficiency. The concierge didn't even raise an eyebrow when my empty tummy insisted I find a McDonald's or something and asked for directions. They have apples at the desk for guests to enjoy and the lobby is spacious and well decorated. The location is ideal for those with business to accomplish, and not too far from the scenic Port Area. I stayed for three days and enjoyed every moment. The meeting rooms were well equipped and the food was amazing. The beds are heaven. The lack of a coffee maker in each room was the only thing I would wish for. They even have internet access free to guests in a room off the lobby. Wonderful Place.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: earlybrass
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sofitel several times over the past few years. The one problem that I've always had is service. I go to Montreal on business and stay anywhere from 3 to 10 nights at a time. Everyone from the front desk to houskeeping have an indifferent attitude toward the guests 7 out of 10 times. I've stood at the desk waiting to ask a question and waited while the doorman, desk staff and bell staff had a long personal conversation before someone finally, rather grudgingly, helped me. On the good side, the hotel is fairly new and decorated in deco style. Beds are very comfortalbe and baths are marble with separate shower and large,deep tub. (deluxe room) Large closets and the usual chair/ottoman finish the simple and clean decor. Houskeeping is spotty and all the little things that make a 4 star hotel a 5 star hotel slip away. Hard to get service in the resturant, that serves average food. Montreal is a real food town and you do much better walking to any of the many excellent local places. The staff is almost universally young and badly trained. I stay or the Omni and the FourSeasons trained staff there could run rings around these people. The locals all share the same low opinion of the staff and the hotel in general. You can do much better

Reviews.Title: “Montreal at is best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Use to be a regular guest somewhere else(the vogue), but I had to try the sofitel and I was just amazed by the entire hotel. I had a nice junior suite on the 17th floor with a great view of the mont-royal and olympic stadium tower. The bathroom was so large :2 sinks, large oval/roman bath, large rain shower (we could fit almost 5 persons the shower!) and separate toilet. The sofitel bed is really like sleeping on a cloud, didn't want to get up in the morning!! My only complaint for the suite will be the sofa, very small, low and not too confortable, but the suite itself was large and clean. The regular rooms must be smaller but nice too. If you order room service try the lobster spring rolls, so good! I had to order a second portion !!(as an appetizer). The entire staff is really friendly from doorman to barmaid. At check in, when I turn to go take the elavators, a manager welcomed me with my name and holded an elevator for me, I was chocked in a good way of the quality of service and how did he knew my name, he was not even at the front desk!! Location is really good, in a nice "chic" part of downtown. Will certainelly return!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Sofitel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my Aunt and daughter out for lunch at the "Renoir" in the Sofitel hotel. The service in the restaurant was excellent. The food is quite pricey but tasty for the most part. Lunch cost just over $150 plus tip. No children's menu. Valet parking for lunch was $8 plus tip. Several days later my daughter and I stayed at the Sofitel Hotel while she had time off from school. There is a very large and beautiful stained glass in the lobby. The Hotel has paid alot of attention to the bedrooms and beds. Makes for a great night sleep. The room we stayed in was small but comfortable. The shower with a large glass door was spacious with an oversized shower head in the ceiling for rain effect. The RogerGallet soap supplied, was a wonderful treat. This is a nice place to stay for a business trip to Montreal. Nearly all of the hotel staff were very professional and helpful. There are no special welcome considerations or treats for children as my kids have become accustomed to in the Loews "Vogue Hotel on Mountain Steet.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice enough But....”
Reviews.Author: quincytoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice enough, however I would not rate it as a 5 star or even a 4 1/2 star hotel. The check in was very quick as my business had direct paid for my stay the hotel aruthorized $500. on my credit card for incidentals.....which was not needed......a couple of hundred sure but $500.00 seemed a little steep. Well it did until I saw the room service and restaurant prices...:( $16.00 for a Hot chocolate and Baileys was crazy considering it was a inferior tasting chocolate mix. The first morning I awoke I came down with a horrible flu. I tried waiting until housekeeping came to make up the room until I went to bed but when it was 2 in the afternoon and they still had not come to clean I phoned Housekeeping and explained my problem within one hour they sent a cleaner who quickly cleaned but did not replace the glasses....... The beds were very very comfortable and the down quilts a nice touch..... but I wondered if they cleaned the duvet covers regularly as when I first walked into the room I saw a smudge on the cover. The bathroom could have used more counter space and the tub was very very small but the shower was lovely :) The service was a l ittle on the slow side and truly I am not sure that I will be using this hotel again....surely for the money they command there are nicer places with more polish in Montreal???

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: tmandgs
Reviews.Content: Wife, 9-mth old daughter and I stayed at Sofitel for 3 nights. Best service I've had in Montreal, Toronto, San Fran or New York. The negative reviewer must have hit a really rare rough spot because we had lots of requests and required lots of assistance, and everything was anticipated and done quickly and professionally. They accomodated rquest for in-room fridge (baby food) crib (gave us a teddy bear too) extra towels and candles, numerous boiled water requests for formula etc etc etc. Even retrieved cellphone from car in parking garage within 10 minutes (and never a hand held out for a tip - but they deserved every tip they got) . Fantastic. The Room was bright, spotless, and comfortable - candles, flowers, bathrobes & slippers, turn-down service, great toiletries. Food from room service was fast and great. Location is perfect. Highly highly recommended. It isn't much more expensive than big north american chains but worth every penny. Already booked a return stay. Treat yourself even if you don't deserve it, and try to get a deal on executive suite. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: canoehead
Reviews.Content: Terrific stay in a deluxe room for five nights - $199CAD/nt. Every staff member was courteous and extremely helpful. Great respite at the end of the day. Bathrooms are large - generous, high-end toiletries provided. Complimentary Evian water in the evening. Broadband in the room. Good fitness facility. Complimentary coffee at Reception in the morning. No complaints, we will stay here again!
